direction.raw_text: (12,000 B.C.) The world turns below us, vast and slow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A shadow sweeps over the land. We move with the shadow. We cast the shadow. Landscapes slide by. Reduced by altitude to abstractions: river deltas, forests and flood plains. A raw natural world. No trace of civilization. The shadow glides over mountains and glaciers. Across an ocean and a pale beach. Over lowland plain at the foot of a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walk out of the shadow. They are men - and yet not men. Their skin is snow-white. Their features heavy and classical - as if Rodin's Thinker had risen from his seat. Their smooth heads are earless and hairless. Their glittering eyes entirely black. Against the stark land their height is impossible to judge. They are ENGINEERS. Two of them are cloaked in dark robes of strange design. The third is naked. One of the cloaked Engineers opens a featureless black box: inside lies a cake of dark, sticky material. The naked one lifts the dark cake with ceremonial slowness. It hums and buzzes. Foams into iridescent spheres. He raises the seething cake to his mouth like the sacrament.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: boil out of the dark material. Swarm over his lips. Glittering insects that chitter and bite. Under the swarm his lips melt away. A horrific vision of teeth, black blood, dissolving bone. They are devouring him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fevered glimpse of the microscopic: cells rupture and bleed. Protein chains unfold. A DNA spiral unravels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The scarabs fill their bellies with genetic material.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...spreads his arms. Stands cruciform, nearly headless. The scarabs swarm his shoulders, his chest. When they reach his hips, he collapses sideways, toppling majestically like a felled tree. Engulfed. The two cloaked Engineers watch impassively. Behind them, a vast black SHIP hangs in the sky. As if blown by a great gust of wind, the scarabs disperse in their millions in all directions. Living DNA on the wing. Where the sacrificial victim fell, nothing remains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pristine wilderness. The VOLCANIC MOUNTAIN in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands on a height, staring in amazement: far off a great dark ship hovers over the plain. A black scarab lands on the back of her neck. Bites deep. Injecting its cargo of DNA into her blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A microscopic invasion. Cells pierced and infused. DNA strands twining and mating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pupils dilating with shock, breath hissing into her lungs. She slaps the back of her neck. Looks at her hand. The scarab lies in her palm. As she watches, it crumbles to dust and blows away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drifting motes of light against the dark: a starscape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . An EXCAVATOR floats into view: a sturdy vehicle equipped with robotic arms. Bright floodlights beat at the darkness. Inside the cockpit - a bubble of glass - sits a BEAUTIFUL WOMAN. This is DR. JOCELYN WATTS, 32, a precocious scholar of many disciplines. A scientist accustomed to field work. The cockpit is sweltering: she wears shorts, boots, a T-shirt - and still her arms and legs gleam with sweat. Watts works the controls. The excavator descends toward a rocky surface. Silt billows up as the excavator approaches: we're not in space at all, but deep underwater. The excavator's thrusters are cowled propellers. The "stars" are plankton shining in the floodlights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts steers the excavator to a steeply sloping cliff wall. A sea-trench yawns below her, its depths lost in darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving to survey site B... closing on object four. The large oblong. She watches the screen of a ground-penetrating radar system. A bright signal return: something hidden in the cliff in front of her. Something big.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts carves into the cliff with the excavator's digger arm. Silt and boulders fall into the yawning trench below. She brings a water cannon to bear: uses its jet to blast away loose silt and stones. The cliff face collapses: a muddy landslide into the deeps. Watts backs away from the collapse, thrusters whirring to keep her out of the turbulence. A cloud of silt clears. In her floodlight beams, the OBELISK stands revealed - its outlines worn by the ages. Easily thirty feet tall. Watts stares at the obelisk, stunned. Her voice is husky:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin. Here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A second excavator glides out of the dark. At the controls: PROFESSOR MARTIN HOLLOWAY, 48, visionary genius and archaeologist. Dark-haired and lean, with the rangy build of a frontiersman. He's dressed in work trousers and a T-shirt. Stubbly chin. He plays his floodlights over the obelisk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts floats her excavator down the front of the obelisk. Scanning the alien text. Suddenly she stops. Grips the obelisk with her excavator's arms to anchor herself in place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need to see this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway pilots his excavator expertly up to Watts's. Mates the two vehicles at their aft hatchways.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind Watts, a hatch opens with a splatter of water. Holloway climbs in. Squeezes into her cockpit. A tight fit. He's distracted by her body, pressed so close - but she has eyes only for the inscrutable writing outside the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same thing again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An ephemeris - a star map. (POINTING) Radius, inclination, azimuth...more data here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we can get epoch and equinox out of that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we raise this thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) Hundreds of tons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A research vessel at anchor on a turquoise sea. Bright sun. In the distance, a coastline dotted with villas. The horizon is dominated by the VOLCANIC PEAK - the same peak we saw in the distance in the prologue. Aboard the research vessel, cranes lift Watts and Holloway's excavators out of the sea and onto the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under an awning, PRINTS of the obelisk's faces are stretched on the deck - fifteen feet long. Watts and Holloway crawl over the alien text, red markers in hand. Parsing, translating, calculating. They're tanned, fit, the wind in their hair. The Mediterranean coast in the distance. It's an idyllic way to work. But they're utterly absorbed in the task at hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're still at it. Lights illuminate the workspace. The obelisk prints are blanketed with markings and annotations. Holloway sits at a table. Watts sits on the marked-up prints. Both working through calculations on electronic slates. Holloway looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a solution. A single match.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too. Checked it twice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You first. Watts holds up her slate: it displays a set of stellar coordinates. A detailed star map. Holloway holds up his own slate: an exact match. They lock eyes in electric excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We go there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A gleaming space station like a five-spoked wheel rotates grandly against the Pacific Ocean a thousand miles below. Black letters on the white metal read: WEYLAND'S WHEEL. A round shuttlecraft approaches the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A spacecraft no bigger than a private jet. Holloway and Watts sit strapped into acceleration chairs. The only two passengers aboard. New to space travel, Watts tears her eyes from the spectacle of Earth outside the window. Holloway plays with a pen, batting it from hand to hand in the zero gravity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's first? You do climate, I do genetics?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Archaeology first. Let our ancestors tell the tale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think he's serious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Serious enough to send his private shuttle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weyland can send his shuttle out for pizza. (DELICATELY) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin. If this meeting goes like the others, maybe we should...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't go like the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know? Holloway plucks the pen from the air. He points out the window, where the crescent Moon shines like a toothy grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heaven smiles on our enterprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shuttle docks with the Wheel's hub - a perfect fit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A gleaming capsule elevator with windows to the stars. Holloway and Watts float weightlessly inside, moving from handhold to handhold. The door closes. Watts grabs Holloway by the collar. Pulls them roughly together. They kiss. Not for the first time. They have a way. Watts's hair and clothing float free: she's a naiad in Holloway's arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator descends along the spoke to the rim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A luxurious lobby. Tasteful lighting. Eames-era furniture in wood and chrome: the past's vision of the future. At the rim, the Wheel's rotation supplies gravity. An elevator door opens. Watts and Holloway step out - Holloway with a sleek metal folio slung over his shoulder. The floor is the outer surface of the Wheel: in both directions it curves upward out of sight. The walls are all windows: on one side, Earth rotates lazily. On the other, a wheeling field of stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: an android, stands waiting for them. He's cunningly built, but no one would mistake him for a real human being.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Professor Holloway. Dr. Watts. My name is DAVID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, DAVID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Weyland's eager to meet you. He strides off across the foyer. Watts and Holloway exchange a wondering glance and follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leads past models of planets, moons and asteroids. Holographic labels and data swirl around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are all the planetary bodies on which Weyland Industries has mining claims. The end of the hall is dominated by a huge globe of Mars. Markings indicate widespread surface activity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Mars. Weyland's crown jewel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is that going? The terraforming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say you're getting diminishing returns. It's not working.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the greatest engineering project ever attempted. Challenges are inevitable. Mr. Weyland's a determined man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits behind a mahogany desk. He's a Warren Buffet type: a country sage, horse-sense and hard knocks. He might be seventy years old, or a hundred and seventy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Behind him stands DIRECTOR LYDIA VICKERS, a slim woman of 45 in a costly business suit. Shrewd and watchful. Once a great beauty, she now trades in ruthlessness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands against the wall. Watts and Holloway settle into chairs in front of Weyland - Holloway holding the metal folio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Professor Holloway. Ms. Watts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor Watts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me. Peter Weyland. He notices Watts looking curiously at DAVID. He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah. DAVID here's a prototype. Our 80 series. One of a kind for now, but if he performs, he will be legion. (his smile fades) What do you want here? Holloway looks at him, startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We sent you a prospectus that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Assume I know nothing. Holloway swallows. Lays the metal folio on Weyland's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm an archaeologist. He touches a tiny remote. Holographs appear in the air over Weyland's desk: the folio is a three-dimensional imager. Pictures of a younger Holloway in the field: excavating ruins in Egypt, China, Peru, Greece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In my studies I discovered a pattern I couldn't explain. Every eleven hundred years, sudden advances in agriculture, tool use, technology. Inventions. Something caused a great leap forward. Every eleven centuries. The pattern holds as far back as our data goes. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tens of thousands of years. I had to understand this. It became the focus of my work. Weyland nods. Holloway glances at Watts and forges on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Watts was a student of mine. Watts touches her own remote. The holographic display turns to scientific diagrams. Images of a very young and beautiful Watts in the laboratory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was analyzing historical changes in human DNA. I found the same pattern. Every eleven centuries, a pulse of new information in the genome of the human race. All over the world. Evolution can't do that. Something was changing us. Changing the DNA of our species.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Humanity's been visited. Visited by...beings from somewhere else. Behind Weyland, Vickers can't suppress a scowl of disdain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean aliens. A beat. The others had forgotten Vickers was there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lydia Vickers, Director of Operations. Practically my right hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They guided us to civilization. Lifted us up, again and again. I call them the Engineers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once you know what you're looking for, it's amazing how the evidence falls into place. Photographs flicker through the display: Holloway and Watts in the field, excavating new sites. Intimately close. Their finds: columns of writing on stone tablets in Egypt, China, Cambodia, Peru. Patterns of lines, curves, and dots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the writing of the Engineers. We've found it on every continent. And last year, we found our Rosetta Stone. The display shows the Engineer obelisk under the sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The writing is a formula giving the location of a single star in our sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which star?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're keeping that confidential for now. But that's where we want to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to pay for an interstellar research expedition!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a chance to be part of a revolution in scientific...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't sell me, professor. You've been turned down by every university and government agency under the sun. Nobody's going to gamble that kind of money on your hunch. Holloway deflates. Watts winces. This is a bloodbath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody but me. (HE GRINS) I've read your research.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's impossible. Our research is-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quantum encoded on secure servers, yeah. We have an A.I. division, you should know. Doing impressive things. (he leans across the desk) I know which star you're wishing on. The scientists stare at Weyland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're bluffing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeta Two Reticuli. He regards their shocked faces with satisfaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how I got this rich? I ask myself: what does God spend his time doing? And I go and do that. Watts laughs incredulously. Stifles it. Weyland's not joking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biotechnology was good to me. Fusion power. Lately doing well with gravity systems. He swivels his chair toward the window. Earth shines outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what's the first thing God did?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He made the Heaven and the Earth. Weyland jabs a finger at her like she's won a carnival prize.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I'm talking about. You left out my favorite part. The piece about Earth. DAVID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For eons, Earth's climate swung from hothouse to ice age. Explosions of life, then mass extinctions. But twelve thousand years ago the swings stopped. The Holocene Epoch began - a period of anomalous tranquility. The rise of civilization began only then. Holloway and Watts stare at DAVID with new appreciation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that change coincides with a visit by the Engineers. They didn't just change us. They changed our world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the piece I mean. Engineering Earth. God stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He swivels back to his desk. Rummages in a drawer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My people checked your science. They say it's solid. He pulls a thick contract out. Drops it in front of Holloway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you your expedition. Ship and crew, supplies, support. One condition. Holloway picks up the contract with the cautious joy of a man double-checking a lottery ticket. His voice is husky:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get the discovery. Control of the site. But any technology you find? Anything at all. That's mine. Holloway reaches out slowly and picks up the contract. Riffles the pages of small-print legalese.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take DAVID with you. My eyes and ears. And Vickers...you're going too. Vickers stares at Weyland in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A glittering formation of white crystals. Diamond on diamond. The structures grow more complex as the view widens. Leaves and branches of crystal. A shimmering field of white jewels. A landscape of white crystals, smooth as snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A black void shot with stars, far from any sun. A sturdy prospecting ship forges through space, travel-worn but built to last. It carries the Weyland Industries logo. The name painted on its hull is MAGELLAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship's nerve center and control room. Six control stations, empty and quiet. Interior lights dimmed to blue. The entire forward bulkhead of the Bridge is a window: wall to wall, floor to ceiling. At the window stands the android DAVID. He gazes at the cosmos with an expression of utter serenity. After a long moment he turns away. Massive shutters close over the window as he walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks the ship's long central corridor. The ship is silent. The lights dimmed to blue. He is alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long steel room containing a dozen plexiglass sarcophagi, six on each side. Sleep freezers. Inside each freezer: the shadowy shape of a human body rimed with frost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks through the compartment, surveying the sleepers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits at a display table, moving intricate technical documents across the surface with waves of his hands. His eyes intent on his work. If he is reading, then he`s reading at a speed no human could match.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We pull away from the frosted crystalline horizon, the smooth white curves like snowy fields. Form becomes clear. It's the body of a woman. It's Watts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts lies asleep in her underwear in a plexiglass freezer. Pale. Frost on her skin. Venus sculpted in ice. There are IV lines in her elbows and ankles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Shapes move into view beyond her, outside the freezer. FACES. Pressed to the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of the freezers are open and empty, save two. Holloway lies in one. In the next, Watts. Three men in blue coveralls crouch beside Watts's freezer, staring inside. They are DOWNS, 30, a lean fidgety crewman. STILLWELL, 40, a sturdy fellow with the geniality of a labrador. And KAMAROV, 26, whose dark, brooding air belongs to a man twice his age.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that. Kamarov opens the lid of Watt's freezer. Leans over her. Watts stirs in her sleep, a drowsy angel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wakes up slow. Watts wakes to find three men looming above her. Disoriented, she pulls away. Tangles her hands in her IV lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Get out of there! Holloway's voice cracks like a whip. The crewmen jump back. Holloway sits up in the next freezer over. He yanks the IV lines out of his arms and legs. Climbs out of the freezer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give us a moment, will you? The crewmen file out: Stillwell sheepishly, Downs and Kamarov surly. Holloway goes to Watts. Gently removes the IV lines from her ankles while she plucks the ones from her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm out of sorts. Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never worry. He helps her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts sit at a table, both a bit hung over. They wear civilian clothes. Warmly dressed, they still look cold. They nurse mugs of coffee and nibble packaged snack bars. Watts hunches over, shivering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My head's buzzing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just slept two and a half years. It'll pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like you've done this before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've read all about it. Two ship's officers enter the room wearing blue coveralls with rank insignia: GLASSE, 45, a stocky man with thick black hair, and BRICK, 50, a bald man with a bristling mustache. They look at Watts and Holloway with little pleasure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleep okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, thanks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain'll see you now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits at his desk. With his bristling beard and powerful build he has a swashbuckling look, like the captain of a whaling ship. Holloway and Watts sit on a steel bench in front of him. He sits scanning his orders: a plastic packet with Weyland Industries logos, cracked open. Watermarked papers inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeta Two Reticuli was surveyed already. A hundred years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By an unmanned probe. Very crude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No Earthlike planets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what are you looking for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Proof of the Engineers' existence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Confirmation of Professor Holloway's theories would change everything. There'd be science before Holloway and science after. Janek rubs his face wearily with his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your ticket. I'll put the ship where you want. Run your scans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, your crew's been up for a week. We could've used the time. Why'd you wait to wake us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better for discipline. (off their silence) Men ship out as prospectors for one reason: the percentage. Find a gold mine or a habitable planet, and you're set for life. (he laughs bitterly) But this contract says no percentage. No bounty. Just triple pay. The men aren't happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You unhappy too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm always unhappy. He stands. Presses his palm against a wall panel. A safe opens. He pulls out a massive pistol in a gunbelt. Tosses the orders into the safe. Lays the gun atop them and locks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts take possession of their cabin: a simple but spacious room with twin beds and a window to the stars. They drop duffel bags on the bed. Holloway surveys the arrangement. Frowns. He releases the magnets that lock the beds down. Slides the beds together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts set up their workspace - a central display table and huge display surfaces on the walls. Fascinating documents slide under their fingertips: an Engineer alphabet. Ancient art. Climate and genetic data.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appears in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I wondered when we'd see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I trust your database is in order. I set it up myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All's well, I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to go. Hesitates in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should tell you: the time you spent sleeping, I spent studying your research. Holloway and Watts look at the android, his words sinking in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You studied our work for two and a half years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's quite a data set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you've seen everything. Well. What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances over the documents displayed around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your hypothesis is...bold. The audacity of it. Your climate data's undeniable: the Holocene Epoch was engineered. Dr. Watts, your genetic studies are equally conclusive. Pulses of cultural change are harder to prove, but even there your case is strong. I believe in your "Engineers."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A utilitarian sitting room. Steel benches and table bolted to the deck. Seated here are two Weyland Industries technicians:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a stocky computer engineer with a genial bearing and a bristling salt-and-pepper mustache.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a dour, rangy woman with a plain face, her hair pulled severely back. A physicist and chemist. They wear black Weyland Industries jackets. They radiate intelligence and competence. These are pros.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leads Holloway and Watts past the break room. Holloway spots the technicians. Strides in to greet them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weyland Industries! Mr. Chance. Ms. Ravel. You remember Dr. Watts. Watts and the technicians exchange greetings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About the materials I gave you. Some of the technical aspects...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll handle our end of the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there is a job. Holloway blinks at her. Chance explains, not unkindly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We only have a job if you find something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts follow the imperturbable DAVID down a steel corridor to Vickers's cabin door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An open-plan cabin like an urban loft apartment. Watts and Holloway follow DAVID inside. Vickers rises to meet them. The walls are industrial steel - but the floors are lushly carpeted, the furniture opulent. A king-sized bed, a mahogany desk, a dining table. Gleaming machines ensure Vickers never need step outside: a private hypersleep freezer, an autokitchen, a medical pod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that a Pauling medical pod? There's only ten of those things on Earth! I guess nine, now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told Mr. Weyland I wouldn't compromise my standard of living. He accommodated me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, I had to cut my manifest. This used to be the number four cargo bay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do for you, Professor? Holloway gestures with the slate he's brought with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're about to reach the system periphery. I thought you'd want to see the search protocols we -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I was set to be the next CEO of Weyland Industries. Then you came along and sold Mr. Weyland on...this. So here I am. Out of the running. I'll go where I'm told. But don't ask me to play along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But when you get back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be five years behind the curve. Out of touch. Over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You might make the discovery of the ages. Vickers looks at him as if she's dealing with a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't believe in what we're doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Weyland believes. That's enough. She walks them toward the door. Interview's over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we're out of communication, you can tell the crew what we're doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't know? They volunteered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They volunteered blind. Classified job, triple pay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crew - Brick, Glasse, Stillwell, Downs, and Kamarov - sit on crates in an improvised lecture hall. Holloway and Watts in front of them. Janek at the back of the room. A hologram shows ancient images of divine visitations. The crew is visibly spooked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aliens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shitting me? Stillwell is staring at the frightening images: gods and titans towering over mortals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think all our mythologies are race- memories of the Engineers. Horus the Sun God. Prometheus bringing fire from heaven. A pillar of fire, a pillar of smoke. The Engineers are the gods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Kamarov stiffens, smelling blasphemy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mythology gods maybe. God is God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kamarov. Let him talk. Stillwell's staring unhappily at the ancient images: gods towering over mortals, inhuman and terrifying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we're going to meet these things?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We probably won't meet anyone. You'd expect a star-traveling race to generate radio or laser signals. Fusion drives and gravity drives have clear signatures. But Zeta Two Reticuli is silent. And the Engineers have gone missing on Earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the pattern, they should've come to Earth seventeen centuries ago. And again six centuries ago. But no sign. After twelve thousand years...they stopped coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?" They turn. Janek grins at Holloway across the cargo bay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that the question you've come light- years to answer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only my first question. I have many.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Magellan arrives at the periphery of the system. A distant star like Earth's Sun, surrounded by orbiting planets: mere sparks at this distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside the vast Bridge window, the star Zeta2 Reticuli burns, a cold beacon in the night. Downs, Glasse and Brick sit at consoles. Janek paces in front of the window. Holloway and Watts enter - and gape at the view. Janek grins at their reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome to Zeta Two Reticuli. Edge of the system. Open her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Magellan opens its eyes: two immense telescopes emerge from the ship. Irises open to expose huge lenses. Antennae deploy: unfurling like wings, gleaming and vast. Sifting vacuum for any whisper of information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside the window, the planets orbiting Zeta2 Reticuli are no more than bright stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Overlay. A heads-up display appears, overlaid on the glass. The sun is labeled ZETA2 RETICULI. Markers point out the planets and trace the ellipses of their orbits. Like magic, the planets swell into colorful orbs, each labeled: Alpha, Beta, Gamma...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven planets. Two hot rocks, two gas giants, three snowballs. Nothing Earthlike. Watts grins at Holloway, eyes shining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First humans in the system. Vickers walks onto the Bridge with DAVID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Director. Good of you to join us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did I miss?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just getting warmed up. (TO HOLLOWAY) Professor? You know what you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: scan, thirty hertz to three hundred gigahertz. Spectroscopic passes on every planet and major moon. Infrared and albedo scan for hot spots and light sources.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man knows what he wants. Run it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twin telescopes spin and zoom. Antennae flex and focus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The planet nearest the sun rushes closer as the mighty telescopes zoom in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Magellan's sensors peel planet Alpha like an onion and put it back together again. A river of data floods the display, bathing the watchers' faces with light: Chemical compounds, magnetic field lines, lunar orbits, topographical data. The scan moves on to the next planet, and the next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Negative on radio chatter system-wide. Nobody's talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Negative for laser and maser. On the H.U.D., the data stream completes the last planet. Begins to illuminate the gas giants' moons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No biological markers. No artificial light. No industry or agriculture. Dead system. Like always.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piss-poor, too. Low in heavy elements.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a hit! A moon. LV-426. The display centers on Epsilon, a gas giant with many moons. Data flickers around one of the larger moons: LV-426.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eighty-six percent Earth's mass. Atmosphere's nitrogen, methane, sulfates. Faint returns for a bunch of metals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything else? The sensors complete their pass on the system's last moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take us in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Downs. You heard the man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, Captain. Maneuvering. Eighteen hours to orbit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Magellan retracts its vast antennae and telescopes. The engines fire: the ship rockets toward the gas giant Epsilon and its mysterious moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leaving the Bridge, Holloway and Watts find themselves walking aft alongside DAVID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Enjoy the show?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know that I "enjoy" things. It was informative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was, it was. (TEASING) You know, I've seen more convincing humanoid robots. Watts smiles, watching Holloway's sport. DAVID's speech never varies from its agreeable tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My design's not intended to convince. Simulating humanity is a complex task that diverts resources. My designers dispensed with that burden to optimize for intelligence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why look like a man at all? Why not be a box on wheels?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being shaped like you, I can use spaces and equipment designed for you. But I'm not so limited. I hear frequencies you can't hear. I see wavelengths of light invisible to you. I move faster. Exert greater force. The scientists look at DAVID in wonder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see yourself as a superman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He turns his unearthly eyes on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a man at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts lie on their bed in their clothes - her head on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if they're really there? (off his confusion) The Engineers. They could be there. Waiting for us. What then? He laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then all my dreams come true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Magellan has arrived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is a gray moon shrouded in clouds. Behind it looms its father planet Epsilon, a lurid gas giant banded in red and gold, half swallowed in darkness. The Magellan dives into a forced orbit around LV-426: rockets firing continually, nose pointed down. Telescopes, sensors and antennae sprout once more from its hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone's here. Janek and his crew seated at control stations. Holloway and Watts standing on the foredeck. Vickers and DAVID. Ravel and Chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fills the window: a gray orb of mist. The ground invisible beneath the clouds. Sporadic lightning flickers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Start with passive systems. We're uninvited guests. Let's be quiet. That thought sends a nervous shiver through the others. Janek nods at Glass and Brick. They study their instruments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lot of electromag, all random. That's lightning. Going to bugger up our scans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go active. Mapping radar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Radar emitters extend from their housings like cannons. A THUMP of power as they hammer out a blast of energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The display paints data on the moonscape as the wavefront comes back: terrain rendered in luminous green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we just rang the doorbell, if anybody's listening. Kamarov shakes his head fearfully. Crosses himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Icecaps at the poles. Frozen methane. Cold down there. The display fills with light: a wave of terrain data sweeping across the moon's surface as the Magellan orbits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terrain data rezzing up. Hey! We got hard spots. Radar-opaque. Bright reflections. That's metal. A jolt of excitement pounds through everyone on the Bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Magellan sweeps on around the gray moon, radar emitters humming, antennae and telescopes open wide. The gas giant Epsilon fills the sky behind LV-426. As it circles, the Magellan launches SATELLITES. Metal motes hurled into polar orbits around the Moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-four "hard spots" shine on the moon's surface: an irregular array circling LV-426.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not natural.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see stuff like that sometimes. Mineral deposits. Volcanic ejecta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big one there. A new signal appears on the map. Brighter than the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still quiet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No comm signals. No signs of life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to get below the clouds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The prospecting ship descends through buffeting grey clouds. Telescopes and antennae stowed away. Hull streaming vapor as it cuts atmosphere. Lightning flashes and booms around the descending ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone strapped into chairs - except Janek, who stands gripping a stanchion, his boots planted on the deck. The landing engines roar. Wind screams over the hull. Mist whips across the Bridge window, obscuring any view. Watts reaches out. Squeezes Holloway's hand. The Magellan breaks through the cloud cover into clear air. Below the ship, a vast and eerie landscape is revealed. Wide valleys mottled with thin dark ground cover. Barren crags and spires of rock. Waterless and wind-swept. Watts gasps. Stares at the grim and foreign country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Magellan thunders over valleys and craggy ridges of rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek takes the helm. Guides the Magellan down a valley as if it were a helicopter. A pilot born.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming up on site seven. They crest a mountain higher than Everest. Before them stretches a dry barren plain. Scattered rocky peaks rise from the desert floor - an alien Monument Valley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Holloway points to a smaller mountain peak. Oddly regular.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look there. Janek expertly swings the Magellan sideways. The Magellan circles the mount, nose pointed inward. It revolves below the watchers: flat faces, clean edges - but cracked and timework. It glitters like coal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we recording? Glasse nods irritably. Of course they're recording. Vickers stares at the pyramidal peak, nonplussed. Teetering on the brink of belief. Watts scans the data readouts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tungsten, tantalum, aluminum. That could be technology.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see the next one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A second oddly regular peak, even more decrepit than the first, sits on the brink of a vast canyon. Landslides have eaten at its edges. The Magellan purrs over the landscape, dwarfed by the scale. Drops between the canyon walls to circle the mount.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts stare at the structure. Beginning to get over the shock. Thinking like scientists again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Identical, apart from weathering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could be a rock formation. Carbon crystallizes like that. The scientists pay him no mind. They're past that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see the big one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek pilots by instruments alone. Clouds obscuring the view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Closing on the major site... The ship descends into clear air. A stunning panorama unfolds before them: craters, hundreds of meters across, connected by trenches. Like a pattern of crop-circles sunk in the rock. In the middle of the central crater - a huge angular peak, larger than the others. The Magellan circles the site. It's awe-inspiring. Cryptic. Huge. Holloway stares in rapture. Glances at Watts: she nods, eyes shining. She's with him. The crew's still skeptical - but starting to wonder. They shake their heads and exchange looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No radio. No heat sources. Cold as the grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody home. Watts looks out at the timeworn peak. Its eroded facets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think anybody's been home for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the central crater, four canals extend outward like points of the compass. Some connect to smaller craters. One canal peters out, flush with the desert floor. The Magellan lands at the end of this canal - half a kilometer from the central crater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stare out the window, down the wide straight canal at the pyramidal peak in the distance. Holloway looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Let's move. Janek glances at his instruments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's only six hours of daylight left. Maybe you should hold off. Watts looks at him incredulously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got that outside the windows and you want to wait `til tomorrow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The expedition party emerges from the airlocks - riding CARGO ROVERS, robotic vehicles just smart enough to carry their owners around, or follow along behind them. The rovers' beds are loaded with gear; the explorers ride on running-board seats. All wear space suits. Holloway drives the first rover with Watts beside him. Stillwell, Kamarov, and Downs in back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drives the second rover with Milburn, Fifield, Chance and Ravel aboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The air here will kill you, so keep an eye on your supply and watch your seals. Pathogen tests are clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move slowly. Stay together. Don't touch anything. Things may be more fragile than they look - or more dangerous. There might be technologies operating here we don't understand. The crew of the Magellan exchange uneasy looks. Still uncertain what to think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trench grows deeper as they follow it toward the central crater - the pyramidal peak framed ahead of them like a monument on a triumphal avenue. They cross a perpendicular canal. Glancing left and right, they see smaller craters with central peaks of their own. They pass through the shadow of a high promontory of stone atop one bank of the canal. We see - and they do not - that the far side of the promontory has a Sphinx-like FACE of monumental size. So eroded that its artificial nature is uncertain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crater floor is a vast enclosed plain. The pyramidal mount looms in the center - colossal in scale. The rovers enter the crater, trailing plumes of dust. They circle the pyramid. On the south face of the pyramid, an IRIS DOOR of many blades stands, easily fifty feet high. Seemingly made of the same basaltic stone as the pyramid itself. A huge construction. The explorers are transfixed in awe. All skepticism banished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me that's a natural formation. (HE GRINS) Undeniable proof of alien civilization. You were here on this day, thirty-one December, year of our Lord 2172. History will remember your names. Watts stares at the iris. Its bottom-most blade is broken; it lies in rubble at the foot of the door. A dark knife-like aperture leads into the pyramid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door's open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek and Vickers watch the explorers' progress in the main holographic display: their tinny voices echoing over the comm link. At the sight of the huge iris door in the pyramid, both Janek and Vickers stare in blank astonishment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch. They were right. He turns to stare out the window at the pyramid's peak. Vickers turns and slips out of the Bridge. Hurries away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vickers strides through her quarters. On the far wall there are two small doors. She opens the first: steps into a luxurious bathroom. Washes a pill down with a tumbler of water. Returns to her cabin and opens the second small door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CONTINUOUS A chamber walled with steel panels. A deep hum of ventilation and power: there's a lot of technology here. She turns to a console beside the door. Flips a row of switches. The hum deepens. Hidden mechanisms stir to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On foot, explorers press inside - Holloway and Watts in the lead. Their flashlights cut into the gloom. The robotic rovers follow them: their six-wheeled chassis with independent suspension trundling over the rubble barrier, sure-footed as goats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dark and cavernous. Weak daylight slants in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The explorers press into the darkness on foot - the cargo rovers' headlights flashing on. They move through a dark cathedral space, empty and bare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks around in fascination, his eyes raking the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jocelyn. Here. His voice trembles with urgency. He shines light on the rock. Symbols engraved on the dark surface. Dots, lines and arcs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The writing of the Engineers. Conclusive connection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands beside them. Stares at the alien writing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations, Professor Holloway. Watts passes her light over the writing, recording it. They move on into the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lingers. Reading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - VARIOUS PASSAGES The interior is a labyrinth. Corridors big as railway tunnels intersecting and diverging. The explorers wend their way deeper. Several carry map units, whose holographic displays render three-dimensional maps that expand as they explore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway leads the explorers deeper into the complex. The motors of the cargo rovers whine and growl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: trails the others, eyes raking the blank walls as if he sees something there. He reaches out. Passes his hand through the air as if grasping a cobweb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sounds down the corridor, freezing them. Holloway sweeps his light that way. The sound comes again: a DEMONIC VOICE speaking some unearthly language. Watts looks at Holloway - but his eyes are focused on the dark ahead. He moves forward. A beat. The others follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . An APPARITION appears before them. A PALE, LUMINOUS GIANT fifteen feet tall, with hollow eyes and a grotesque snout. It strides toward them. Speaks in a sonorous voice. Pandemonium. Watts backpedals involuntarily. Seeing Holloway stand his ground, she reaches out to him in a panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin. Martin! But Holloway doesn't budge. Stares at the Apparition in fascination. Everyone else scatters - except DAVID, who stands stock-still by the wall. Watts watches as the Apparition walks right up to Holloway. Disappears with a sizzle of static as Holloway experiences the creature passing through him. Silence. Watts returns to Holloway's side. Stillwell and Downs are huddled on the deck. Milburn and Fifield have fallen back down the passageway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ. Christ!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't real.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all saw it. Unseen by the others, DAVID reaches out and repeats his gesture in the air. A rumbling sound down the corridor, as before. Moments later, the Apparition appears round the corner again. They stand their ground: the ghostly giant strides toward them, exactly as before, and disappears with a crackle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Recording?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more. I'm out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifield. Get a grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a prospector. You find a load of bauxite, I'm your man. But not this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should go with him. Buddy system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. He hauls a heavy rolling case out of the cargo rover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can deploy the drones. Drop them in the first or second nexus on your way back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give us a rover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And half our gear? It's no more than a mile. You can walk it. Sulking, Milburn takes the rolling case. The remaining explorers watch Fifield and Milburn backtrack into the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts lead their party up to a massive door, sealed tight. In design and scale, undeniably important. Holloway glances at his map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This should lead to the core of the pyramid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack it open? Or cut through?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's do as little damage as we can. Ravel waves a sensor over the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's power. Current flowing in the wall. Chance begins to inspect the frame of the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we can hack it. Has to be a mechanism...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks as if they fail to see something obvious. He points at a spot on the wall beside the massive slab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull up a rover. I want to get up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek stands at the window, looking down the long canal at the distant pyramid. The ship's powerful imaging systems stream data: stereoscopic feeds from the explorers' flashlights; a map that grows as they explore. The maze under the pyramid drawn in light. A globe of LV-426 blooms with terrain and weather data as the satellites feed the ship information. Vickers appears at Janek's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Director. Taking an interest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my operation, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A junction where multiple passageways converge. Milburn and Fifield trudge into the space, trundling the probe cases behind them. Tunnels lead away in all directions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grand Central Station. They open the case. CAMERA PROBES tumble out: spheres the size of softballs, studded with lenses and sensors. Tiny lights come on as the probes awaken. They roll off, dispersing to investigate every passageway. Bumbling into walls and pillars, reversing. Exploring by random walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's check the feed. Gimme the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had the map unit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have the map? They stare at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you serious? He trudges back the way they came, in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands on top of one of the cargo rovers. He's cut a hole in the wall beside the door, high up: he works with probes in the mechanisms inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like a three-state switch. A deep BOOM, echoing inside the ancient walls. Nothing moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One moment... He moves a control. BOOM. The immense door begins to rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CORE CHAMBER The vast central chamber of the pyramid. An immense space. Holloway walks in, his flashlight searching. Watts hurries after. The others follow, rovers tagging along. A colossal structure stands in the center of the chamber, convoluted and strange. A mechanism. Chasms yawn in the floor all around it, their depths lost in darkness. The explorers enter, rovers in train. They lift their eyes: hundreds of feet above them they see the pyramid's apex from within. A SHAFT OF DIFFUSE LIGHT penetrates the pyramid somewhere near the peak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is something, now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Yes, it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The android's awareness is keyed to a high pitch. He seems to read meaning in the inscrutable structures all around them. Holloway hauls a drone case out of the rover. Two dozen spherical drones tumble out, wake up, and roll off into the dark. They are nimble, hopping curbs and skirting chasms. Watts looks at her atmosphere sensor. Astonished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin. This air's breathable. The core chamber brightens as the sun outside moves into alignment. The shaft of light perfectly centered. A vast SIGH as if the pyramid itself is breathing. A fat drop of water falls on Watts's glove. She looks up in surprise. Another falls on her visor. And then it's raining inside the pyramid. Water trickles into the chasms, inundating the mossy growths that cling to the walls. Holloway looks at Watts with a little boy's grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miracles and wonders! The shaft of light moves on. The core chamber dims slightly. The rainfall stops as suddenly as it started. The explorers follow the main path around the periphery of the chamber, past a gallery of mysterious machines. There are marvels in the shadows. Cells in the dark apparatus open on startling deposits of color: translucent alabaster flutes. Honeycombs of pure gold. Matrices of crystal. Watts waves a scanning instrument as she walks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Intense field readings. Huge power sources here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CORE CHAMBER - RAMP They arrive at a wide opening in the floor. A strange ramp curves downward - its floor segmented and saw-toothed. A bafflement: it's not a staircase. Not an escalator. No moving parts. No rails or tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Space below us. A big space. As they stand looking, a probe bumbles up to the opening and goes bounding down the ramp. Watts laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How does this work? She begins to descend on foot. Holloway behind her. Stillwell, Downs, and Kamarov grudgingly follow. But DAVID looks away across the cavernous chamber - fixated on the central crystal. He beckons Ravel and Chance to follow him, and walks away. Ravel and Chance look at each other in astonishment. Uncertainly, they follow DAVID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway, Watts, and the crewmen reach the bottom of the ramp, breathing hard. A cargo rover trundles down after them. They look back up. The ramp above them is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ravel. Chance. Where've you gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Where are you? (to Watts, indignantly) They didn't come down! But Watts is staring through an archway. Transfixed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. She walks in. Holloway follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A passageway punctuated by alcoves as big as band-shells. In each alcove stands a biomechanical apparatus - shaped from the same dark material as the pyramid itself. Each apparatus implies by its design that a giant is meant to fit inside it. Holloway and Watts walk the concourse, playing their lights over the dark machinery. Their footsteps echo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you see, the size of them? Like that ghost we saw...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't a ghost. Where are the others? I don't want to go back up. Watts fiddles with her suit's comm controls. Listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They switched to channel three. I hear them talking. They're okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should stay together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milburn and Fifield are lost. They bumble through the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not the same place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is! That is the same freaky thing we saw before. He points at a detail of the architecture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No it's not! The other one was more... sort of...fuck it. (taps his comm) Milburn to Magellan. Come in. Static.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts round a corner and stop in their tracks. Kamarov, Stillwell, and Downs almost run into them. The scientists stand frozen. In front of them lies a dead giant. An ENGINEER. If he were standing, he would be fifteen feet tall. He is roughly human in shape. Barrel-chested. Withered to the bones. There are bulky protrusions fused with his flesh: hard to say whether they are equipment or parts of his body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . His head, lolling to one side, is severed from his body. His eyes seem to be covered by goggles; but if so then the goggles are fused with his skull. An elephantine proboscis, severed now, once connected to a protrusion on his hip. The giant lies frozen in a convulsion of agony. His jaw gaping in a silent scream. His corpse is marred by hideous wounds: slashes that cut through bone. The explorers move closer. Speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God in Heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin. Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Look. He lifts his light. Beyond the dead giant, a vision of Hell: A dozen DEAD ENGINEERS lie heaped against a sealed door. Twisted in postures of torment, murdered in the attempt to escape. All bear horrific wounds. Scene of an ancient massacre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek and Vickers stare dumbstruck at a 3-D view of the dead giants captured by the explorers' cameras.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The explorers circle the decapitated giant, hushed with awe. Holloway steps close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "There were giants in the earth in those days...and when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, they bare children to them, who became mighty men." Genesis six four. Lays a gloved hand reverently on the giant's ribs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said don't touch anything! You said don't touch anything!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The size of them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In all the old mythologies, the visitors from the sky were giants. Watts joins Holloway beside the dead Engineer. Touches the corpse in her own turn. It's hard as stone: ossified. She traces the ancient, terrible wounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were killed. All of them. Downs stands staring at the dead giant, as shaken as Kamarov.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We shouldn't be here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. The dead can't hurt you. (adjusts his communicator)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Chance. Ravel. I've got something here. Static.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Communications are going to hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the Magellan's satellites hurtles along, high above the moon's atmosphere. It passes over the terminator line between the night side and day side. Through the clouds below, a lightning-laced storm front rolls across LV-426 like a wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rising winds pluck at the ground cover outside the window. Janek turns from the view to look at the holographic globe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All hands. Back to the ship. We got a mean storm front rolling in. I repeat. All hands...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing beside the dead giant, Watts and Holloway look at each other as the signal comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (STATICKY) front rolling...back to the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've found something here! I'm not walking away for bad weather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek shouts into his communicator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway! I got two-hundred-kilometer winds with airborne silica and enough static to fry your suits. Get your asses back here! Now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway races their cargo rover away from the pyramid, wheels kicking up dust. Watts rides in back, securing a bulky payload under a tarp on the cargo deck. Stillwell, Downs, and Kamarov clinging miserably beside her. Watts looks back: A massive storm front chases them. A tidal wave of dust shot through with lightning. Gale-force winds tear at the ground. Lightning lashes the pyramid and the crater wall. Reaching the Magellan, they see the other rover already in the airlock lift. DAVID, Ravel, and Chance aboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway roars into the lift at speed, the rover skidding almost into the opposite wall. Watts leaps down. The storm wall catches up to them. Screaming winds rip through the lift. Dust fills the air. Visibility plunges toward zero.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me unload!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She pulls at the tarp. It tears halfway free - and fills with wind, snapping taut with such violence that Watts is hurled out into the storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts tumbles helplessly: a leaf in the wind. CRASHES into a metal stanchion. Clings, the wind knocked out of her. Ears ringing. Nothing but static in her headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway stares in shock at the place where Watts vanished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jocelyn! With inhuman reflexes DAVID reacts. Grabs a tether. Latches it to his suit. Locks it to an anchor point on the wall. Dives into the storm. A ballet nearly too fast to follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lets the wind take him. Skids across the ground, controlling his trajectory. He hits the stanchion where Watts is lodged with a CLANG as if he were made of iron. Watts stares at him in mute astonishment. He locks her suit to his. Activates the tether unit's winch. It whirs, reeling them in through the hurricane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and the other crewmen haul Watts and DAVID back inside. Holloway and Watts embrace fiercely as the lift rises toward the safety of the ship. The crewmen bundle the rover's tarp-wrapped cargo into a sealed dumbwaiter that rises independently into the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The explorers strip off space suits. Watts pulls her helmet off. Catches DAVID's eye across the airlock. Mouths a silent Thank you. He gives her the barest nod and vanishes into the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The explorers exchange looks. A mood of exuberance and wonder prevails now that they're safe home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Day one. Smiles of wonder as what they've seen comes home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got to hand it to you, professor. You were right. Both of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's in the tarp? What'd you bring back? The explorers from Watts and Holloway's party exchange looks and burst into laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. We're two helmets short. He points. The lockers labeled MILBURN and FIFIELD stand closed. The helmet racks empty. The laughter cuts off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They didn't come in! They stare at each other, listening to the wind wail outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek speaks urgently into the communicator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Between the wind speeds and the static electricity, there's no safe way to get to you. You're going to have to hunker down until it passes. How are your provisions?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) We got air . Water and food tabs  suits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey sacks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifield and Milburn stand miserably in a murky passageway. Fifield hitches up his space suit's crotch uncomfortably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we're piped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate these fucking things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) We hate these fucking , Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe next time you'll mind your maps. Keep your heads down. We'll come get you in the morning. A burst of static answers him: Fifield's voice scrambled by the storm. Unintelligible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Magellan out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All hands present excepting the two missing men. Janek plays his squeeze box, its archaic music filling the air. Tired and exuberant, the men sway and dance mockingly. Holloway has a champagne bottle open in each hand. He fills steel cups left and right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My friends. What we do here marks the greatest achievement of our species. Contact with another civilization. Humanity came of age today, on this moon. You were there. (raises his glass) To history. They raise cups and drink. Even the crew moved by the moment. But Janek smiles crookedly and toasts again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To Milburn and Fifield. The first human beings to freak out, get lost, and sleep in their suits in the ruins of an alien civilization.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vast dark maze. Milburn and Fifield grope their way through the dark with flashlights. The storm howls outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you looking for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (groping along the wall) Someplace things can't come at us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's gonna come at us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands beside Vickers at her holography terminal. He lays his hand on over a signal plate - and the terminal lights up with a three-dimensional image. The core chamber of the pyramid, from DAVID's point of view. It's apparent that DAVID's eyes see more than human eyes do. He seems to see heat and electromagnetic energy as well as visible light; calibrated readouts are overlaid on the scene. The structures in the pyramid are surrounded by complicated patterns of energy. This is incomprehensible technology.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The core of the pyramid. You see. Vickers goes rigid, looking at it: avarice in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to protocol two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A high-tech science facility behind glass. Watts and Holloway, in lab gloves and smocks, open the dumbwaiter:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . An ENGINEER'S HEAD rises into view, ghoulish and elephantine. Vapor rises from it. A readout blinks: STERILIZED. They lift it onto the steel table. It takes both of them. They pass scanners over the skull. Images accumulate and rotate on the laboratory displays. X-ray and ultrasound. Holloway leans close to study an X-ray image. He almost seems to see a ghostly second face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin. Look. She traces the head with an ultrasound probe: under the vibrations a seam opens up around the edge of the face. She gets a fingertip into the seam. Works with a probe. Pries away the long-dead Engineer's mask. It comes free. The visage revealed is human, except for its giant scale. White-skinned. Earless. Hairless. Withered but beautiful as a Greek statue. Eyes closed. An expression of suffering on its face. Watts drops the ultrasound probe in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look like us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We look like them. Genesis 1:27. "And God created man in his own image. In his own image created He him." Vickers and DAVID stand outside the lab window, staring in at the god's head. Vickers looks shaken. DAVID, fascinated. Watts covers her nose in revulsion. A horrible stench: The Engineer head begins to disintegrate in front of them. Flesh oozing, skin peeling. Accelerated decay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's breaking down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Formaldehyde! Urgently they ransack cabinets and storage rooms. Watts finds a clear plastic drum and dumps its contents. Holloway drags five-gallon jugs of preservative out of a cabinet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches through the window, almost amused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mortal after all. They lift the rotting head into the drum, retching. Fingers skidding in putrefaction. They pour formaldehyde over it. As soon as the head is immersed they rush to strip off their reeking gloves and smocks, scrubbing their hands. The god's head sits in its murky vat, shedding skin and tofu- like chunks of white flesh. The noble face disintegrating. Watts and Holloway stare at it, breathing hard from their work. Vickers flicks on the intercom from outside the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your cadaver's interesting. But I'm more interested in the machinery in the pyramid. The core chamber. What do you think it does? Watts stares at Vickers incredulously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could anyone know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what it does. Silence. Holloway looks at Vickers wearily, as if he's seen this conversation coming. He glances at Watts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think. What we've seen. What we know. Watts rises to the challenge. Thinking on her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-four pyramids scattered around the moon's equator. Massive power supplies. Vents in the walls. Atmosphere changes. Breeder tanks... (she's got it) The pyramids are terraforming machines. Holloway grins, exuberant. His theory playing out perfectly. He doesn't see Vickers stiffen. Her hands curling into fists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why Earth's ancient cultures built pyramids: in imitation of the gods. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twelve thousand years ago, beings from the sky set pyramids on the Earth and transformed the world. That's what they were doing here - before their civilization failed. Watts stares at the head in its tank. The severed neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It didn't fail. It was wiped out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milburn and Fifield have bunked down in a new chamber: they slouch against a wall. Milburn sweeps the room with his headlamp. Stoops to lift something into the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: three feet long and thick as man's thumb. Its hard shell is gray. It has a hammer-head like a shark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus! Put it down! He leaps back, wild-eyed. Milburn laughs at him. Lets the eyeless centipede wind its segmented body around his space-suited arm. In the flat face, a white vertical slit appears. Changes quickly to a horizontal position; opens enough to suggest a mouth. Milburn doesn't notice this development.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax. Your suit's bug-proof. Hell, it's bulletproof. The centipede spirals around his arm, glittering, its body moving in fluid waves. The blind head quests between his fingers. Milburn loses his nerve as the thing's mouth suddenly gapes wide as a shark's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough. He tries to pull it off. The centipede locks its segments together and digs in with its body. It might as well be made of iron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get it off! It's crushing me! Fifield pulls out a utility knife. Cuts into the centipede's body behind its head. A gout of greed ACID spills over Milburn's glove.
