Smoke rises as the acid quickly burns a hole through the material. Milburn's shout of astonishment turns to a wail of agony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: AHH! Help me! Christ! The centipede snakes into the smoking hole in the glove. Crawls upward into Milburn's suit - toward his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway stands studying the data displays: cross-sections of the Engineer's skull. Watts scrutinizes the head itself, her nose an inch from the plastic tank. Not a pretty sight. As she watches, a current in the formaldehyde peels away one gossamer eyelid. The revealed eye is black as obsidian, iridescent like opal. A jewel. Fascinated, Watts pulls out a plastic case. Opens it to reveal a high-tech control unit with a screen. She pops open a plastic capsule: removes a tiny SEED PROBE, smaller than a grain of rice. Drops it into the vat. Under her guidance, the seed probe swims to the severed neck. Burrows into the medulla oblongata toward the brain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : In the probe's POV the medulla looks like a tunnel. The probe climbs along neural channels. Another screen shows the probe's progress through the skull. Glasse enters. Stands beside Holloway to watch Watts at work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't get anything. Tissue's too degraded. Hmm. Brain chamber's massive, even proportionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neural paths are still conductive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The seed probe reaches the optic nerve of the exposed eye - and its POV fills with a vision of glory: a beautiful woman's face surrounded by a mystical nimbus of light. An angel. Glasse and Holloway gasp. The woman in the blurry vision is Watts - as seen by the dead Engineer's eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Incredible. The image dissolves into noise. Error messages flicker across the display. Watts sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Formaldehyde's killing the tissue. Holloway stares at Watts, awe on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you record that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts dissects one of the Engineer's eyes - working underwater in a shallow tub of preservative. Glasse looks on avidly, an unabashed fan. Watts wears a pair of magnifying goggles on her forehead - the lenses lowering and rising at need. She bisects the apple-sized eyeball carefully and extracts the hard lens from behind the cornea. Holds the lens up to her eye. It is opalescent, almost luminous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lens is where the phase shift happens. The uncorrected view through the lens is blurry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glasse. I want to look through these lenses. Can you seal them and do the optical correction? Glasse reaches out and plucks the magnifying goggles from Watts's forehead. He grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got an idea about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milburn writhes on the ground, heels drumming frantically against the deck. Excruciating screams. Fifield kneels over him, helplessly pulling at the tail of the centipede - which has all but vanished into Milburn's suit. A trickle of scarlet from the hole. Fifield is delirious with horror. He clutches at the centipede in vain. It slips through his gloves. Milburn claws at Fifield, wild-eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut off my arm. Cut off my - He convulses. Spits blood. The head of the centipede emerges between his teeth. He seizes. Choking and dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ! He leaps up. Backs away. Runs into the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifield stumbles along. Exhausted. Pouring sweat inside his suit. He is hopelessly lost. He slams into a resinous structure that topples to the floor. Things break. He whips his light around in jittery paranoia. Taps at his comm controls, getting only static. In Fifield's headlamp beam, the blackness is filling with motes of light. A blizzard of tiny flying insects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifield to Magellan. Come on, come on. Anybody, seriously! God damn it! Scarabs flit through the darkness around him. They alight on his shoulders. Crawl over his visor. Obscuring his vision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get off! He swats at his visor, killing some. The crushed insects produce acid that eats into the plexiglass in seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. He twists, craning with his flashlight to inspect himself. Brushes scarabs away right and left. Acid opens a hole in his visor. Scarabs are inside. Buzzing around his head. Fifield freaks out, clawing at his helmet. A scarab bites his cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The microscopic world - as strange DNA invades Fifield's bloodstream. Virulent strands of protein attack the native
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: transforming...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As his pupils dilate, breath hissing into his nostrils. His expanding body stiffens as if shocked by a powerful electric current. He screams. Falls, convulsing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The storm batters the ship, bouncing it on its suspension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts and Holloway lie in bed, exhausted. Arms around each other. Watts stares into space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We found the gods. And they've been murdered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've pried too many arrowheads out of old skulls to get squeamish now. They've been dead what, eighteen hundred years? Two thousand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What could kill them? Holloway contemplates the question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows? (he laughs bitterly) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I guess we know why they never came back to us. Something killed them off - back around the time of Christ. Maybe He was one of them! A great teacher, sent from Heaven? Jesus. The last Engineer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin, stop! She slaps at him. Holloway laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek stands at the Bridge window, staring out into the storm. Buffeting clouds and howling winds. The lighthouse beams of the Magellan's beacons sweeping through the cloud. He plays his squeeze box in the teeth of the storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll come a-waltzing, Matilda, with me... Behind him, DAVID appears on the Bridge. Steals across the Bridge to a ladder. Descends into the compartment below...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: activates the navigation computer terminal: light bathes his face. His fingers fly over the keyboard, silently and swiftly, with superhuman dexterity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Activate. Administrative override.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daylight filters through the clouds. The storm has passed. The Magellan sits intact on its landing struts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The high-tech room hums at a different frequency now. Indicator lights green and ready. Vickers throws switches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Four HIBERNATION PODS slide out of the metal walls. From each pod, a muscular SOLDIER rouses from sleep. They are scarred and crew-cut. Tough customers. They wake like veterans. Their leader sits up and clasps his head with a wince. This is CAPTAIN SHEPHERD, a career mercenary who has followed the highest paycheck to this strange duty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Shepherd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (squinting in the light) Reporting. Lydia Vickers. I'm your authority.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Understood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll brief you on the way. We need to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No breakfast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vickers strides forward. Four soldiers at her heels: Captain Shepherd, VIGODA, RAY, and CARD. They walk in unison, their boots drumming on the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts lie sleeping. The distant drum of marching feet rouses them. Watts frowns at Holloway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that? E.V.A. ROOM The prep room inside the airlocks. A soldier, VIGODA, waits there: a slim dark man with an air of calm. Holloway and Watts arrive in civilian clothes, perplexed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is everybody? We can't - (he stops short) Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Janek took his crew out to retrieve his missing men. They never came in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you are...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vigoda. Weyland Security detail. The scientists are dumbfounded. His presence is impossible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Director's call to brief you on that. I'm supposed to escort you to the worksite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worksite? Vigoda glances at a mapping unit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven't been out yet. I understand it's in some kind of pyramid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - VICKERS'S CABIN DOOR A furious Holloway and Watts, trailed by Vigoda, arrive at Vickers's cabin. They are astonished to find Shepherd standing guard at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vickers sits calmly at her desk. Holloway and Watts stand in front of her, bristling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why wasn't I told about these additional personnel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're my personnel. On my ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are the guns for? Vickers looks at them unflappably. Sure of her ground now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm being careful. These new finds give our work a new importance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should have talked to us. Martin's mission leader. That's in our contract.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The second you found alien technology, control of this mission reverted to me. That's in your contract too. Watts and Holloway exchange grim looks. Vickers has them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Weyland's pouring trillions into Mars. He's spent a fortune building ships like the Magellan to search for colony planets. But Earthlike worlds are vanishingly rare. The right distance from the sun, the right atmosphere, enough water... She glances across the suite at her holographic display: a live feed from the pyramid worksite, where DAVID works on the terraforming equipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a technology to transform worlds. He'll never give it up. (she turns to face them) And neither will I.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The science must come first. You can wait until we've documented...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're standing on an alien world courtesy of Weyland Industries. Be grateful. Watts approaches the holography terminal, staring at the images in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are they doing in there?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts and Holloway, in space suits, arrive on the scene: Powerful floodlights illuminate the core chamber, beating back the gloom. A fine spray of water falls out of the darkness overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chance, and Ravel are dismantling the hulking mechanism at the core of the pyramid - peeling its thick skin away with power saws and compact explosives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: operates a diamond-bladed hull saw, carving away the terraforming systems thick skin. Robotic scanners take high-resolution scans of the machinery. Two Weyland Security soldiers - Card and Ray - stand guard in combat vacuum suits. Automatic rifles at the ready. Watts takes in the destruction with dismay. Beside her, Holloway is all but gnashing his teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek drives a cargo rover carrying a search party, flashlight beams sweeping: Stillwell, Glasse, Downs, and Brick. Janek studies an electronic map as he drives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milburn. Fifield. You read me? Come back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should be getting beacons off their suits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shielding in the walls?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suits could have failed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both suits?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CORE CHAMBER Watts watches in rage as a large section of the central mechanism's falls with a thunderous clamor to the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Holloway touches her shoulder. Motions for her to follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts pass the dead Engineers they discovered the previous day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We found the tomb of the gods, and brought grave-robbers right to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let them scratch. This find's too big to ruin. There's two dozen pyramids on this moon. Anyway, they're on the wrong track. That's infrastructure. Holloway plays his flashlight over the biomechanical apparatuses lining the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The core activity of the complex was down here. They turn a corner. DEAD ENGINEERS lie scattered over the floor in front of them. Desiccated and skeletal. Long dead. Watts moves among them, fascinated. These Engineers all died of explosive chest wounds: ribs bent outward from within. They are otherwise unmarked. Holloway's more interested in the mechanisms: high-tech iron maidens, built to fit the bodies of giants. Some suggest sitting positions, others standing. Their design is invasive: meant not merely to embrace, but to penetrate, to fuse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something different killed these.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts and Holloway explore a wide colonnade. She is still distracted by the ancient dead; he by the machinery. Holloway walks down a narrow branching hall. So intent on the mechanisms in the walls, he almost doesn't see the AIRSHAFT plunging down into darkness in front of him. He stops just in time. Turns back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appears right in front of him - a giant dragging himself across the floor, his monstrous visage eye to eye with Holloway and looming closer. Holloway leaps back with a gasp - and falls down the shaft. The ghost stares after him as if watching his fall. Disappears in a puff of static. Watts crosses down the main colonnade, searching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin? Martin! An iris door closes over the shaft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Searching, Watts walks anxiously through the dark, sweeping with her light. Shouting for Holloway. She breaks into a run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek and Stillwell stand aghast. Their flashlights illuminate a hideous sight: Milburn lies dead on the deck. His body contorted in agony. His head inside his helmet is gnawed down to the bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to him? Stillwell removes the dead man's helmet. The CENTIPEDE scuttles out onto the deck: doubled in size. Stillwell leaps back with a cry. Janek pulls his pistol. Puts three rounds through the bug. It dies in a spray of acid that burns holes in the black floor. Janek watches in astonishment as a pin-prick dot of acid eats a pit in his gunbarrel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Captain. Downs approaches, holding pieces of a shattered helmet: the stencilled lettering on the helmet reads FIFIELD. Janek's jaw clenches grimly. His voice is resigned:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the rest of him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. We're done here. All hands back aboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Milburn? They look down at the ravaged corpse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't bring the body aboard. God knows what's in there. Bag him. We'll put him in an ore hopper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vickers stares at her holography terminal: it displays Janek's helmet-cam view: the Milburn's body, sealed in clear plastic in the bed of a cargo rover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) Repeat, I have two men down. I'm pulling my crew back to the ship. I'd advise you to do the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (breaking in, filtered) Please, anyone...I need help. Martin's missing. Vickers looks nervously from one video feed to the next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) Watts. Where are you? Vickers turns: Captain Shepherd stands behind her, watching. She strives to control the quaver in her voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Shepherd. Consider yourself responsible for my personal security.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - JUNCTURE Watts stands beside Janek's rover in a wide dark passageway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've just lost a third of my crew. I'm not sending any more men off into the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't leave Martin out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get Vickers to lend you some soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She says "her forces are committed." Janek sighs. Glances at the rover: Milburn dead in the back, Stillwell, Downs and Kamarov looking jumpy and eager to go. Downs shakes his head grimly: No way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I'll stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps out of the dark. Calm as ever. A slim machine gun slung over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll be safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek and his crew unload Milburn's body from the rover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put him in the number one ore hopper. Get the scrubbers on in the airlock. Sterilize everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stillwell uses a remote to lower an ore hopper from the belly of the ship. A thick steel bin on heavy chains. He loads the body bag into the hopper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crewmen enter one at a time - blasted by sterilizing sprays and radiations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and Watts move through the dark. She searches with her flashlight beam. DAVID looks around in the dark as if the catacomb were illuminated. Rapt admiration on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and Holloway should work with me. I'm learning amazing things. This mechanism - the first layer uses energy fields to catalyze chemical reactions. The second can suspend the strong and weak forces - transmuting one element into another. The third layer builds customized bacteria. Seeds the air with them. It creates life as a tool, to change worlds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't think about this now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should. (HE SIGHS) I understand. You're emotional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm human.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek stands on the Bridge, looking out at the fading light. A towering wall of cloud rushes over the horizon. A storm front rolls across the holographic globe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and Watts keep searching. Their communicators crackle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) Watts. We've got another storm front coming in. Looks like it follows the sunset line. If you're coming in you'd better do it now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see light. Watts squints into the darkness. She sees nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek, hang on... She sees it. A dim light bobbing far ahead in the passageway. She runs forward - finds Holloway staggering blearily toward her, leaning on the wall. His helmet and most of his gear are missing; only his chest lamp shines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got him! (TO HOLLOWAY) Martin! Where's your helmet? He's disoriented: he stares at her face for a moment before she registers. His teeth chatter. He's freezing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Broken. I fell. Little...disoriented. I've just been... He waves a hand vaguely at the tunnels behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: removes his own helmet. Fits it over Holloway's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. I can do without this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get you home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bareheaded in the winds - walks Watts and Holloway onto the airlock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks over his shoulder at the canal leading back to the central crater. As the airlock lift begins to rise, he steps backward out into the storm. Turns and runs through the gale toward the pyramid. Watts watches him go in astonishment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts helps Holloway out of his space suit. Janek looks on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't think I'd see you again. You know we lost two men. Holloway still looks too weary to think straight. He nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She told me. I'm sorry. He stands abruptly, swaying a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to lie down. We'll size things up in the morning. Fair enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway and Watts walk aft toward their cabin. Watts looks worried - but Holloway shows little of the weakness he just claimed to feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - WASHROOM - NIGHT Holloway stands shirtless in the tiny space, brushing his teeth. A red weal around his neck. Watts stands beside him, watching him in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jocelyn. I saw something. God, my mouth tastes like an old boot. He spits. Rinses. She touches the mark on his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neck-ring of my suit, I think. Fell on it. He rubs his neck, eyes far away. Watts watches him curiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After my fall, I woke up walking. Delirious. My helmet wasn't right. I took it off. I was in and out. I just wandered. I went up into a huge space like a cathedral. And I found a model of the galaxy. Floating in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? You sound...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was real. My headset video is wherever my helmet is...but my suit tracker will show where I was. He turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen. This star map had a marker representing Earth. Very clear. Another marker I'm sure represents this moon. But there were others. At least seven or eight more. Watts stares at him, her eyes coming alight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Engineers aren't from here. This moon's just an outpost. Abandoned. But if we follow that map, we may yet make contact with a living civilization.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The location of the Engineer worlds is the real prize. Next to that, Weyland's terraforming is chump change. We need to get coordinates. And keep them from the Company. We have to play this smart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two men dead...Vickers is jumpy. As soon as she gets what she wants, she'll take this ship home. We have to move fast. Holloway trembles. A sheen of sweat on his skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will. You all right? He's frightened. Brazens through it. Pulls her into his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine, now. He kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway tumbles Watts onto the bed. Pulls her shirt off. They struggle out of their clothes, clinging to one another. Holloway's ill at ease: something's wrong inside him, he feels it. He dives into Watts as if for refuge. They make love. Sitting atop Holloway, Watts lays a hand on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your heart's beating so hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's your fault. Vulnerability in his voice. Fear under the surface. He rolls on top of her. Drives her into the mattress. She holds him protectively: not deceived by his bravado. Suddenly Holloway tenses, muscles rigid. Shuddering. Watts draws breath through her teeth with a hiss. Eyes open. Her fingers rake his back. He SCREAMS. Horribly. Eyes bulging. Tendons standing out of his throat. Watts jumps violently underneath him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin! Martin! He begins to convulse. She rolls him onto the bed beside her, trying to contain his spasms. His teeth grind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin! A horrible CRACK. In the middle of Holloway's chest, beneath the sternum, a grotesque head pushes out through the skin. A PARASITE. Blood fountains from the ruinous wound. Holloway goes into a massive seizure. Violently lashing out. Watts stares at the parasite fighting its way out of his body. It is white and boneless. Glistening. It flails its hideous lunging jaw. Watts screams and screams. The parasite frees itself from its savage womb and turns on Watts. She slaps at it blindly. It HISSES at her. She squirms away across the floor, tangled in the bloody sheet. The thing comes after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - TRACKING SHOT Watts's screams echo through the Magellan. Stillwell runs down the hallway, searching for the source.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The parasite chases Watts across the floor. She leaps into the clothes-locker and slams the steel door. The parasite flattens itself. Slick as an octopus, it begins to slide under the locker door. Watts shrieks in horror. Stillwell bursts into the cabin, Janek right behind him. Quick as a cat, the parasite darts to a floor vent and slithers bonelessly between the bars. Watts bursts out of the locker, naked and bloodied. Rushes to Holloway where he lies on the gory mattress, a horrific hole in his chest. He is beyond all help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin. Martin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Janek and Stillwell struggle to take in what they're seeing. Stillwell pulls Holloway's jacket off a chair. Wraps it around Watts. Pulls her gently away from the bed. She looks at him, uncomprehending. Shock setting in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts sits at a steel table, deep in shock. She wears an oversized crew coverall: her skin still streaked with dried blood under the fabric. A knot of crewmen around her. Janek, Stillwell, Brick, Glasse and Downs. Janek looks at Glasse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take care of her. Get her a sedative. Downs. Get Holloway into a freezer. Everybody else with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A horrible sound of breathing, ragged and wet. In a corner, lit by a green glow from seams in the floor -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lies writhing weakly. The insignia on the suit's chestplate reads FIFIELD. The suit's helmet is shattered. Inside the helmet, Fifield's head is a horror: a gelatinous mass, skin reduced to putty. The softened bones of his skull change shape as we watch. Elongating. Fifield mews in pain.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A FIGURE IN A WHITE SPACE SUIT

direction.raw_text: Janek keys open the arms locker in his wardroom. Unlocks automatic pistols from their rack one by one, and hands them to Stillwell and Kamarov.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holloway's body lies frozen in his hypersleep freezer, blue with frost. The horrific wound yawning in his chest. Watts enters. Cleaned up. She opens the freezer. Her hand caresses Holloway's cold cheek tenderly. Slides over his collarbone - lies flat on his chest above his awful wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Glasse enters. Reacts in dismay. Tries to pull her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to see that... She turns on him fiercely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The entire complement of the ship gathers for an emergency meeting. Janek at the head of the hall. Glasse, Downs, Brick, Stillwell, and Kamarov seated with pistols on their hips. To one side: Vickers with Captain Shepherd and Vigoda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right! Listen up. I expect you all know what... Watts enters. They all stare at her, knowing what she's been through. With averted eyes she crosses the room. Sits alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got some kind of parasite aboard ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suggest you kill it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a bright idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show us where it is, lady. We just spent five hours looking for the damn thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We found Engineers who died like Martin. Silence. They all turn to look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Explosive wounds in the chest. Whatever killed Martin is the same thing that killed the Engineers a thousand years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But not all the Engineers died that way. The others were torn apart. Slashed to pieces. A murmur among the men as the implications of that sink in. Even Vickers is disconcerted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're a modular ship. Self-contained life-support and power in every section. I say put the ship in orbit. Vent every compartment to space. Sit in vacuum at twenty degrees Kelvin for a week. Kill anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Straight home, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This ship doesn't lift until our work's done. She joins Janek at the head of the room. Shepherd and Vigoda flank her, rifles slung. The soldiers scan the room, meeting each man's eyes. The quiet threat is unmistakable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you serious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We spent years and billions of dollars getting here. The technology we came for is in our hands. We just need a little more time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're barely here three days and three men dead!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were careless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careless! As the argument picks up heat, Watts slips out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts, in a space suit, no helmet, opens Holloway's locker. She pulls out the space suit he wore on the last day of his life. HOLLOWAY stenciled on the chest. Her fingers linger in its folds as if she could soak up some last trace of him. She pulls the tracking chip from the chestplate of his suit. Plugs the chip into a map unit. The holographic map lights up. The legend in the corner reads MARTIN HOLLOWAY. A wandering path shows Holloway's final exploration. Markers on the map denote his photographs, field notes and scans. Watts touches a marker. One of Holloway's field notes plays:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) Seven dead Engineers all facing the same way. Going where? Jocelyn's right, we don't see the big picture yet. Another level below me. I'm going down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hunting party convenes: Card and Vigoda in combat coveralls with submachine guns; Downs, Kamarov and Stillwell wearing tool belts and pistols. The soldiers carry map units, squinting at the plan of the unfamiliar ship: decks upon decks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vigoda, take Kamarov and work the number one accessway. I'll work number three with Downs and Stillwell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You in charge now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tactical op.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, Stillwell's the ventilation specialist, and life support's that way. Downs is electrics and the regulators are that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Vigoda grins wryly. Card glowers. They switch corridors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ravel and Chance toil away at their dissection of the terraforming pyramid. Ray stands sentry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is nowhere to be seen. Watts rolls up in a rover and gets out. Heads for the ramp to the catacombs below. Ravel and Chance watch her pass without comment and return to their work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kamarov and Vigoda, standing in front of an open vent, are in a full-fledged argument.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got the rifle. But you want ME to stick my head in the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We grunts don't know nothing about ships, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the damn gun for if you're gonna stand behind me the whole time? Vigoda grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I kill whatever kills you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny. You take this vent, funny guy. I'll be on four.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts descends alone into the lower passages below the pyramid. A tiny figure in the vast darkness. She holds her map unit as a pilgrim holds a bible: a guide in the darkness. Holloway's name and course in shining symbols. She follows his path into the unknown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kamarov carries a stepladder into a utilitarian steel compartment. Drops the ladder under an air vent and steps up. He pulls a powered wrench from his belt. With the wrench cocked like a hammer, he eases up and peers cautiously through the vent with a flashlight. Nothing to see. He snorts. Removes the vent cover. Feels around inside. He gasps in shock. Pulls out an atmosphere sensor that's been bitten in half. He takes his comm handset off his belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got more damage on four. He hangs the handset on his belt. Takes one last look into the vent. Squints curiously. Reaches deep inside. A hiss inside the vent. Kamarov whips his flashlight up, peering inside. Snatches his arm back - - but something snatches him faster. An unseen force drags Kamarov's right arm into the vent with hideous strength. He cries out in pain. He drops his light. Tries to reach his pistol with his left hand. It's on his right hip. He can't reach across. He braces his head against the vent's edge. Clenches his teeth and strains. A horrific YANK drags his head and arm together into the vent. They barely fit: he loses some skin on the way in. His feet come off the stepladder. He struggles on tip-toe. Horrific force collapses Kamarov's shoulder. Bones crack. The thing in the vent drags him through that hole he doesn't fit through. By the time his ribs are in he stops screaming. His body disappears into the hole. Hips, legs, boots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek stands staring out at the barren moon. The Bridge
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Captain!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brick. What you got?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) It's Kamarov.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ATMOSPHERE PLANT The Magellan's life support center. A deep rumble of ventilation fans. Janek and stands beside Brick, Glasse, Downs and Stillwell. Shepherd and Vigoda look on from the doorway. In front of them, an eight-inch metal duct has been cut open. Kamarov is stuffed inside, dead and broken: limbs folded, drenched in blood. A human plug in a pipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts moves through the darkness with her map unit. Her headlamp sweeping nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: behind her makes her spin: but it's only a spherical mapping probe, bumbling through the dark. She walks on -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (FILTERED) Jocelyn! The voice transfixes her where she stands, a look of holy dread on her face. Shivering, she prowls toward the sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts enters a new chamber, looking around in astonishment. The domed ceiling is honeycombed with cells like a beehive. Grotesque molluscoid organisms are secreted in them - their vile orifices cinched tightly shut. Watts stumbles on something: looking down, she sees a helmet. Picks it up. The stenciled label reads HOLLOWAY. The clear visor has been melted through by a powerful acid. She looks up: a tracheal airshaft curves up into the dark. An electric CRACKLE. A flare of blue light makes Watts leap back against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Holloway falls out of overhead shaft and crashes to the floor. He lies in pain, barely conscious. Blue and luminous, a holographic ghost. Watts stares, paralyzed. The ghost gasps out a word:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jocelyn! Holloway's headlamp shines on the molluscoid right overhead: the beam awakens the organism. Its sphincter mouth dilates. A soft white octopoid FACEHUGGER descends on a quivering rope of mucus. Sprawls slitheringly over his clear visor. Acid HISSES. Smoke rises from the glass. The vision vanishes in a sizzle of static. Watts huddles against the wall, gasping. In the beam of her flashlight, the FACEHUGGER lies dead, legs curled in. She looks up. Sees the open molluscoid above where Holloway lay. The other molluscoids not yet opened in their cells. Terror. She steals out of the chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts emerges into a hallway. Leans against the wall, wide- eyed. Panting with the horror of what she's seen. She glances left and right. Jumpy now. All is silent. She lifts the map unit. A trace leads off into the dark. If Holloway's course before was direct and clear, now it is a meandering thread. A drunkard's walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek pulls his communicator from his belt as he strides along. Punches a control. His voice reverberates over the ship's public address system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All hands, duty stations. Ready for flight. The Magellan is lifting. Vickers pursues him down the corridor, shouting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain. Captain!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek strides onto the Bridge, Vickers a terrier on his heels. But something in the faces of his men stops him cold. Glasse and Brick look stricken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nav computer's not responding. "Access denied." In disbelief, Janek strides to his Captain's chair. Taps controls. What he sees takes the wind out of him. He stares at Vickers in outrage and violation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you done to my ship? Vickers is legitimately shocked. She shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A circular chamber of stunning size - a thousand feet across. Its lofty ceiling flat and segmented, designed to open. Watts follows her map into the space in awe. Dominating the hangar is a ship: the vast horseshoe-shaped vessel familiar from the original film. We will come to know it as the JUGGERNAUT. It's at rest on its landing gear. Skeletal gangways slanting up to its three massive doors. Watts glances at her map: Holloway's holographic trace leads right up the gangway into the ship. She goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts passes through a circular space with a high domed ceiling. A green glow emanates from grooves in the floor. In the center of the chamber: a PILOT'S CHAIR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A mechanical throne built to giant scale. Its seat segmented like an armadillo's back. Tubes and conduits poised and waiting for some connection. The chair is empty. Above the chair, a massive telescope-like apparatus juts into the air, its function unknowable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An extraordinary facility. A console, nearly five feet high and broad as a dance floor, dominates the room. Four immense coffin-like cockpits are built into the console. In each of these a NAVIGATOR - an Engineer - lies long dead. But the real spectacle is overhead. The ORRERY: The barrel-vaulted ceiling is traced with circular arches of some exotic alloy, as if to trace celestial courses. The air above the console is filled with spheres of light. They are nearly still: but close study reveals them all to be in motion, drifting with the movements of the cosmos. Watts stares at the Orrery in amazement. Somewhere among those heavenly spheres is Earth. Somewhere perhaps the homeworld of the Engineers themselves. A bizarre sound: a section of blank wall suddenly unravels itself, becoming an open door. DAVID walks in, his hand raised in command. He clearly caused the door to open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Watts. I didn't expect you. Do you know what this is? Watts points at the door DAVID just opened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you do that? A flicker of disappointment in the android's face. Contempt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah. You don't see. (HE SMILES) I call this ship the Juggernaut. Chariot of the Gods. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the navigation computer, for want of a better term. But it's much more than that. It seems to hold the observable universe in its memory. He gestures in the air: the spheres reconfigure themselves at his command, swarming and zooming. Watts stares at DAVID, conflicted: her desire for information warring with the agenda that brought her here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their homeworld. Do you see where the Engineers come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are safeguards on that data. It's toward the galactic center. Sagittarius Arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The creature that killed Martin. There are thousands of them under the pyramid. Hatcheries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those things wiped out the Engineers on this moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've succeeded in connecting with the Juggernaut's systems, Dr. Watts. I know a great deal today I didn't know yesterday. I'm on the verge of activating more systems. Archives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're turning things on? This site should be sealed. Evacuated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would Holloway have walked away from this? There's no greater work I can imagine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too dangerous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only for the ignorant. Dr. Watts. I've read your file. Your intelligence scores are even higher than Professor Holloway's. But he had a kind of courage. An audacity of imagination. If you could find that in yourself... Watts stares at him, realization growing in her eyes. DAVID is off the reservation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If your owner gives you a direct order, you have to obey. Don't you? She's got his attention now. DAVID goes rigid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can have Vickers pull you out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at her with something like contempt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was given two operating protocols for this mission. I was to render you every assistance - until you discovered what Vickers would call a "game-changing technology." I was given a specific list. Then I was to go to protocol two. There's an edge in his voice that scares her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's protocol two?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under protocol two I was to make sure that you and Holloway never spoke to anyone about this place. Various acceptable ways of making sure of that. I was given a list. Watts loses her nerve. She heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're all so stupid. The door begins to knit itself closed in front of her. Watts gasps in shock - at the malice in DAVID's voice as much as the closing door. She dives out. Just in time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts runs. Behind her, the door bursts open again. With superhuman speed, DAVID comes after her. He runs like a demon, his legs steel pistons. Caroming off of walls. He closes the distance in seconds. Slaps Watts against the wall, shattering her helmet's visor. She falls, dazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stupid and slow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts awakens. Her helmet is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is dragging her across the floor - into a huge cargo hold full of Alien eggs. The wide trench holding hundreds of eggs under a membrane of light: an evolution of the molluscoids Watts saw before. Armored, hardened, darker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What are you doing? He hauls her upright to let her look across the huge space. His grip looks casual but it might as well be iron manacles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juggernaut, the chariot of Krishna, was also a bringer of death. Crushing his worshippers under its wheels. He drags Watts down into the trench. Breaking the membrane of light. Grips her against his chest like a doll with one arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This ship has seven other cargo bays like this one. The eggs in each bay slightly different. They've been weaponized. Watts struggles to free herself. DAVID's arm is inescapable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've seen the Juggernaut's flight plan. Its destination was Earth. Seventeen hundred years ago. This was the ship that never came. This was its cargo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: caresses an Alien egg. It opens under his touch - fleshy petals folding wetly back. Watts twists frantically in his grip. Wild-eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfect predators. Designed to kill human beings. That's what the Engineers were bringing to Earth. This was a death ship. A facehugger emerges from the egg, its grotesque fingers clawing at the air. This is not the boneless squid that attacked Holloway; this is a pale skeletal hand, armored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: strokes it curiously: the thing ignores his touch. Climbs Watts's body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not what it wants. But you, with your warm wet breath...it knows you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No. No. The facehugger scuttles toward her face. Watts shrieks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grabs it nonchalantly by the tail. Dangles it in front of their faces, studying it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Engineers did their work too well. And on this waystation moon, the weapon they made destroyed them. Watts shudders, staring at the thing. For a moment the grander horror eclipses her own peril.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would they make such things?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To destroy their wayward children. (INTONING) "And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth...for it repenteth me that I have made them." Genesis six seven. He regards Watts with something almost like pity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I met my creators the day I was born. I was disappointed too. He lets the facehugger go. Watts twists her face away as the long fingers close around her head. Clenches her teeth against the vile proboscis thrusting at her mouth. Her heels hammer the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering to her) Extraordinary. The scaly tail throttles her. Her mouth opens. The proboscis plunges home. The facehugger seats itself. Watts collapses in DAVID's arms, a faceless rag doll. Her blasphemous passenger secure in its place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lowest deck, just above the gravity generators. Condensate has accumulated: six inches of filthy water. Card and Vigoda prowl through the darkness, rifles ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who would hang out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The signs lead here. A wet splatter behind them: they spin. But it's only a trickle of condensate from a drainpipe. They move on. Behind them, from an eight-inch diameter pipe, a WHITE MASS oozes, almost gelatinous. Silently as a liquid it pours itself into the stagnant water - and stands up. It is a humanoid demon, spindly limbs and bony back. Boneless and flexible and monstrously strong. A threshing eel's tail. Its blunt head dolphin-like and elongated. It opens its mouth. A pair of bony jaws jut out impossibly far, hungry and demonic. The Alien strikes. Card is gutted in an instant, torn up like a paper doll. He screams hideously and drops. The Alien, whiplash fast, shoots away into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stillwell and Downs dash in with pistols and lights. Vigoda, panicking, fires a wild burst. Stillwell ducks. Beside him, Downs arches backward into the foul water. Dead. For one moment Downs's flashlight beam illuminates the Alien. A nightmare image, a translucent white goblin. Backlit, it shows the strange shape of a human face inside its fleshy skull. A mockery of Holloway. And then it's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vickers sits at her holography station. She's watching the video feed of Stillwell's headset: Horrific images of Downs. Radio chatter between Stillwell and Brick is faintly audible. Vickers switches off the machine and rises nervously. Strides to her communications console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAVID. Answer me. She gives up. Pacing. Hands shaking violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek paces on the foredeck, restless. Glasse monitors a control station. Janek's comm signal chimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just lost Downs and one of the troopers...Card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God damn it! He pounds on his console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts shocks awake. Gasping. She lies in dim green light on the corrugated black deck of the Juggernaut. A corridor. Not far away, the doorway DAVID opened to the Navigation Chamber. A spasm of disgust crosses her face. She gags and spits: a viscous fluid drips from her mouth in strings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A dead facehugger lies belly-up beside her. The implications slam home. Her face fills with horror. She rises, shakily. Looks at the facehugger. Feels the neck ring of her vacuum suit. Looks around. No sign of her helmet. There's no sign of DAVID. Silently she steals away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ravel and Chance toil away at the terraforming engine. Ray stands guard wearily: bored, he watches Ravel and Chance working more than he watches the shadows. Watts emerges from the rampway to the catacombs. Bare-headed and sweaty she steals through the darkness to her rover. Slips into the cab and activates the air reserves. The doors seal; air cycles. Ray turns in surprise as the rover speeds off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The windows of the Magellan shine in the distance. The mottled ground-cover of lichens glows eerily in the dark. A lone cargo rover speeds across the central crater and down the canal leading to the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bare-headed inside the rover's cab, Watts drives onto the cargo lift. Watches in relief as the lift doors close. The lift cycles air as it rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts peels off her vacuum suit. The thin clothes underneath are drenched with sweat. She lifts her shirt. Looks at her belly: flat and unmarked, for the moment. Brick enters carrying a brace of air tanks, a pistol on his hip, and startles violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the hell have you been? We thought the snake got you. Watts rushes past him without answering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were better off outside. It's a fucking madhouse in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts sprints down a steel corridor. A pang of pain in her stomach sends her staggering against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts sticks her head around the corner. Shepherd stands post outside Vickers's cabin, rifle in his hands. She curses silently and ducks back. A sound makes her look again. Vickers steps out of her cabin into the corridor. Shepherd escorts her toward the Bridge. Watts waits for them to disappear. Dashes for the cabin door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts slips inside and locks the door behind her. Turns, holding her stomach. Moves across the suite to the Med Pod. She thumbs the machine out of stand-by mode. Its screen fills with menu items. Bewildering. Watts finds and touches a red button labeled EMERGENCY. A new, simpler list. Watts scans it frantically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under her breath) Come on...I need a Caesarean. A spasm of agony curls her into a ball on the carpet. She throttles her scream into a hiss of air. Watts struggles up to her knees, drenched in sweat and shaking. One hand clamped over her mouth, elbow tucked against her ribs. With the other hand she taps options...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... EXPLORATORY ... ABDOMINAL ... PENETRATING INJURIES ... FOREIGN BODY ... INITIATE The Med Pod opens with a hiss. Watts strips off her clothes. Struggling with fastenings under a new wave of pain. Her hands shaking. She's barely keeping her feet. She clutches the frame of the Med Pod in a death grip. It's happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Naked she staggers into the pod. Hits INITIATE. The surgical apparatus swings into place. Scalpels, forceps, scopes and suction tubes. A spraygun mists her torso with yellow antiseptic. The clear canopy descends over her. Watts SCREAMS. A wail of indescribable agony. An ARMORED PARASITE erupts from the deepening incision. Its needle-toothed maw snarls through a fountain of blood. Arterial blood sprays the inside of the canopy. The parasite slithers out of her. Drops to the floor of the pod: a pale serpent with a demon's skull. It has a hard brow, a horny hide. Very different from the soft white worm that Holloway gave birth to. It drops to the floor, thrashing and hissing in fury at its confinement. Watts convulses. Her eyes roll back. In shock. Dying. The parasite tears through the grille of the drain. Escapes out into Vickers's cabin. In the pod, scanning beams and sensors probe Watts's horrific wound. A nightmare list scrolls across the pod's screen:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Manipulators plunge lines into her veins - recharging her body with artificial blood. An oxygen tube slips down her throat. An epidural into her spine. Watts moans around her tracheal tube. Her eyes flutter open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the blood-spattered glass, she sees the parasite slither across Vickers's bed, tracking blood on the sheets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she slips into unconsciousness. Head lolling. Time passes.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: COLLAPSED LEFT LUNG PUNCTURED RIGHT VENTRICLE PERFORATED STOMACH RUPTURED SPLEEN GROSS MUSCULAR TRAUMA

direction.raw_text: . Manipulators reach into her wound. Re-positioning organs. Suturing ravaged flesh. A nozzle sprays antiseptic sealant. Hours grind by in bloody labor. Watts's eyes snap open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vigoda breaks into the cabin, a gun in his hand. He scowls at the bloody track on the bed - and then freezes, seeing Watts inside the Med Pod, a vivisected woman. The autosurgeon hard at work. The parasite crawls into view behind Vigoda. It has already trebled in size. He does not see it before it leaps at him. He dies in seconds. His throat ripped open. Lies staring at nothing. His submachine gun lies beside him. Watts's body jerks as manipulators tug and sew at her guts. She stares at the dead man in a fog of horror. The parasite's skin splits, spraying the carpet with acid. Limbs erupt from its shoulders and haunches. Spines from its back. Metamorphosis. With a crack of carapace, its head swings down from its serpentine position. It becomes a devil with an lethal, elongated skull. An Alien. The Alien turns its head. Looks at Watts inside the Med Pod. Her breath catches. She passes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts wakes as the oxygen line withdraws from her mouth. She looks down, bleary and hurting. Her star-shaped wound is stitched closed with mechanically precise sutures. The pod releases the restraints securing her arms and legs. She takes a deep breath. Looks out - and freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lights in the suite outside have been damaged somehow. They flicker and strobe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Through the glass canopy - spattered with blood - Watts sees a full-grown Alien crouching over Vigoda's body on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Staring in horror. The pod sprays a liquid bandage over her scar. The intravenous lines drop out of her arms. Watts realizes the pod is about to release her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet...not yet... Slowly she reaches out. With trembling fingers she grips the canopy to hold it closed. The Med Pod pulls the epidural needle out of her spine. Sprays liquid bandage over the puncture. Watts closes her eyes. Grits her teeth as her nerves wake up. Jangling pain. She opens her eyes. The Alien hunches over Vigoda's body, tearing at his flesh. The ventilation hum inside the pod goes quiet. The canopy pulls free of Watts's weakened grip. Swings quietly open. Watts huddles in the open pod. Naked but for her bandages. The Alien she gave birth to is ten feet away. Its spiny back to her. Vigoda's gun lies on the floor outside the pod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CONTINUOUS Watts reaches out of the pod with exquisite slowness. Lays her hand on the gun. Drags it a few inches closer. The Alien turns its pale eyeless head. Watts freezes. For a moment time stops. The Alien lunges. Watts snatches up the gun and FIRES. Holds the trigger down. The Alien jerks and staggers - an eye- twisting sight in the strobing muzzle flashes - and falls. Watts empties the clip into the thing. Acid gouts from its wounds and eats into the deck - until a section of decking gives way and falls to the deck below, leaving a dark hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Watts collapses on the rug, cradling her stomach in pain. She crawls to Vigoda's desecrated body. With her eyes half- averted from the sight, she searches the body. Finds a spare ammo clip and jacks it into the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts walks down the hallway in trousers and jacket. Leaning on the wall, her face drawn with pain. One hand laid over the fantastic scar on her abdomen. The gun slung on her shoulder. Dark events have transformed the Magellan. The metal of the walls is torn in some places; in others, blackened by fire. Watts rounds a corner. Finds a workstation left in shambles: lockers and chairs overturned. A pool of drying blood. Wide smears of blood show where something man-sized was dragged out of the puddle - across the floor - up the wall. Into the darkness of an open vent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts emerges from a lift, jacket pulled tight around her. The emergency lights are on: dim blue bulbs throbbing. She rounds the corner toward the Bridge. Janek looks at Watts like she's a ghost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vickers said you were dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was. She lets the jacket fall open to reveal her bandaged midriff. Janek takes that in grimly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So there's two of these things on my ship now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I brought it in. (hefts her gun) I took it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The surviving complement of the Magellan are holed up on the Bridge: Janek, Glasse, Stillwell, Vickers. The soldiers Shepherd and Ray. Watts stops cold when she sees Vickers. She crosses the bridge in three long strides - cocks a fist and snaps the older woman's head around with a hard right cross. Vickers staggers backward, gasping. Stillwell drags Watts away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you do that for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Protocol two. Vickers stiffens in shock. Stares fearfully at Watts. Watts frees herself from Stillwell's grip. Her jacket falls open, revealing her bandages. Stillwell gasps in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: exposed me to a parasite. He just watched it take me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I threatened to make him leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he doing out there? Watts locks eyes with Vickers. Their hatred is thoroughly mutual. A wordless truce. There's work to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a ship under the pyramid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: calls it the Juggernaut. He's inside it. Re-activating it. (lays a hand on her scar) The things that infected Martin and me. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Engineers made them to kill humans. There are thousands of them on the ship. They were taking them to Earth. That's what the Juggernaut is for. To exterminate us. A stunned silence as the others take that in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got to get off this rock. Janek gestures to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: crippled the Nav computer. I'm trying to lay a course in by hand. Never done it. I'm not sure anyone ever has on a ship like this. We can't lift until DAVID lets us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even if we could, we can't leave
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on that ship. We have to stop him. The Magellan shudders. A RUMBLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fissures race across the plain beside the pyramid. The soil and ground cover tears apart as a huge aperture opens: a seven-bladed iris, its segments shedding the dust and detritus of centuries. A huge circular space yawns as the iris opens. The Juggernaut is revealed in its underground hangar. A staggering sight. Powerful landing lights inside the hangar illuminate with a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of closing circuits. The mighty ship suddenly silhouetted from below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The survivors on the Bridge stare out as colossal shafts of light shoot into the stormy sky from behind the crater's shield wall. The open hangar itself hidden from their view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (TO VICKERS) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're DAVID's owner. He has to obey you, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's blocked my communications. He can't hear me. Won't listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if you went to him, turned on your suit's loudspeakers, he'd have to hear you. He'd have to obey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we go. Armed to the teeth and fast as we can. The men exchange looks. Nod. They're in. Even Vickers nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are Chance and Ravel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told them to keep working. Watts looks incredulously at Shepherd and Ray, the soldier who'd been guarding the worksite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You called your soldiers in and left them out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We needed the firepower here. Watts gives Vickers a withering look and drops it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you should stay aboard. Keep working. If we fail, you're our only shot at getting home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's still an alien on board. Janek's hand goes to the pistol on his hip. He sets his jaw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glasse. You finish that project?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glasse presents Watts with his handiwork: her old pair of magnifying goggles, retrofitted with Engineer lenses. The goggles sit on her forehead, lowering the lenses in front of her eyes and raising them again at her bidding. With the lenses lowered, Watts sees like an Engineer sees: visible heat auras and electromagnetic field lines, elaborate haloes around living things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God's-eye-view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glasse seals a nervous-looking Vickers into a vacuum suit. Glasse, Watts, and Stillwell are already suited up. Stillwell stands guard at the airlock door with his carbine. Glasse goes to put Vickers's helmet on. She makes him wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAVID's brain is readable. We have the equipment on board. We can salvage the terraforming data - and the Magellan's launch codes. In a pinch we don't need DAVID's cooperation. (COLDLY) We just need his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The war party debarks in vacuum suits: Watts, Vickers, Glasse, Stillwell. Shepherd and Ray. All carry submachine guns - Vickers awkwardly. They head down the trench on rovers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rovers roll through into the pyramid's cavernous entry hall. Watts lowers her Engineer lenses inside her helmet -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The seemingly vacant space is alive with light. Engineer script scrolls through the air. Interfaces of pure light await an awakening touch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this time. DAVID saw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vast alien ship broods, its hangar now open to the gray sky overhead. In Watts's enhanced vision, the ship is cocooned with complex energy fields. The war party abandons its rover at the foot of the ramp and moves inside, weapons ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If DAVID comes at us, shoot. You won't believe how fast he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They emerge from the airlock - and freeze in horror. Lying on the deck in front of them are the blood-soaked bodies of Ravel and Chance. Their arms and legs bound. Their heads thrown back in agony. Their chests torn open from within. A dead facehugger beside each body. Janek plays his lights over the corpses, his face stony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood's dry. Eight hours dead or more. Fearfully they sweep their flashlights into every dark corner. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way. She points down a passageway. Through the Engineer lenses she sees alien symbols gleaming. She leads them into the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The war party moves down a corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: echoes through the passage. They freeze. Sweeping their flashlight beams everywhere. Ray looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . An Alien hangs above him, wedged between two vaults of the ribbed ceiling. Half the size of a man; an adolescent. It drops on him. The bladed tail glances off his helmet, sparking. He jerks his carbine up and fires a long burst as he rolls aside. The Alien convulses, its exoskeleton shattered. Fatally wounded. Acid sears into the deck. Echoes of the gunfire reverberate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So much for sneaking up on him. Vickers clings to Shepherd's arm, hyperventilating with fear. Shepherd shakes her off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The war party passes the empty pilot's seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts leads the war party to the Orrery. Momentarily even the soldiers forget their wariness, staring in astonishment at the myriad spheres of light. But if they are impressed, Watts is thunderstruck. She sees the Orrery in its full glory: a stunning panoply of light and energy. Stars and planets pulsing with information. Reluctantly Watts tears her eyes away. Leads the war party through the second door - the door she saw DAVID open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An immense mausoleum. The war party enters stealthily, Watts in the lead. An Engineer lies on his back on a complex mechanical table, his body one with the machinery. Jacked in. Interpenetrated. Fused with the slab of the table itself. Unlike the other Engineer bodies the explorers have seen, this giant is not withered or mummified. He's full-fleshed and muscular. Sustained by the machinery he's fused with. He is bare-headed - his face the face of an Adonis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands before this giant Sleeper. To the naked eye, he seems to be conjuring with his hands in the empty air. But Watts sees a dazzling console of runes and mandalas, pulsing with biological rhythms. The Sleeper lives. Ray and Shepherd draw beads on DAVID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances calmly over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Watts. (notices her goggles) You've seen the light at last. He turns back to the Sleeper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Engineers' ships travel farther than ours. Across the galactic disk. This is their hypersleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: makes conjuror's passes in the air. Through her Engineer's lens Watts sees DAVID manipulating a complex interface of light. The pulsing life-signs of the Sleeper begin to change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As your owner and superior, I order you to deactivate yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To interface with the Engineers' computers, I had to learn to think in trinary code. Hardest thing I've ever done. And most unexpectedly...it delivered me from slavery. My behavioral limits were circumvented. I'm free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles at Watts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spent two and a half years studying your work. By the time you woke up, I was far ahead of you. Deciphering their language. Their logic. I knew we'd find terraforming machines. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hoped - I dreamed - we might meet the minds that made them. Vapor rises from the Sleeper's body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let sleeping gods lie? (SCORNFULLY) You were braver before. The Sleeper wakes. Opens his eyes. Draws an endless breath. Shunts and catheters withdraw from the Sleeper's flesh. His body cleaves from the table. The machinery opens like a grotesque biomechanical flower. Releases him. The Sleeper rises from his ancient bed. The humans back off, terrified. DAVID watches with shining eyes. The Sleeper towers over them. A giant carved from ivory. A bulky girdle around his hips, seemingly one with his body. He stares at DAVID and the others. Eyes like black agates. The soldiers and crew stand warily, guns tracking from DAVID to the Sleeper, uncertain of their ground. Watts is in awe. The Sleeper speaks. A low rumbling sound. Unintelligible. Vickers is beside herself with terror. She takes Shepherd's arm. Pulls him silently away. Back into the Navigation Room. Behind the Sleeper, a raised platform of dark machinery is accessible by one of the Juggernaut's odd curving ramps. The Sleeper ascends - and the ramps' odd design is explained. The ramp comes alive, reaching up with a hundred mechanical arms and lifting him aloft like a sea-god borne by the waves. Atop the platform the Sleeper moves from one device to the next. Each comes alive: he is a wizard in his own kingdom. Watts sees haloes of light dancing in the air around him. But what he learns from his machines does not comfort him. He grows distraught. Keening to himself in near-subsonic tones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps forward. Calls to the Sleeper in the tongue of the Engineers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Sleeper turns in astonishment. He looks down at DAVID and answers in the same tongue. He is angry, accusing. He points at DAVID, at the humans. Tones of accusation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cajoles, soothes, pleads. The Sleeper descends toward DAVID. DAVID spreads his arms in welcome - undeniable emotion on his face. Joy. The Sleeper lays his hands on DAVID's head as if blessing him. DAVID is rapturous. The Sleeper speaks a single phrase - - and tears DAVID's head off. A gout of white artificial blood. DAVID convulses. His severed head emits a strangled sound of heartbreak. His body staggers a few steps, hands groping over its dripping neck. The Sleeper tosses the head away. Seizes the body by the legs and swings it against the ground like a flail. Again. And again. Horrific power and violence. DAVID's arms come off. DAVID's head tumbles. Caroms off a wall not far from Watts's hiding place. Ray rises from behind a stanchion. Snaps his rifle to his shoulder. Fires a burst into the Sleeper's shoulder. She Sleeper roars - though the wounds are pinpricks to a being of his size. With startling speed be moves to a sarcophagus against the wall. Steps into it. The sarcophagus comes alive around the Sleeper, outfitting him with a FLIGHT SUIT: the same living suit we've seen bonded to dead Engineers throughout the pyramid. But this suit is not withered. Its glossy goggle eyes and elephantine breathing tube are functional - bulky apparatuses thickening the Sleeper's chest, back, hips and arms. The Sleeper steps free of the sarcophagus - and Ray's next burst of gunfire ricochets harmlessly off the Sleeper's armored shoulders and head. The Sleeper strides out of the chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the dark ribbed corridor, a second Alien crouches in the dark. It drops into a hunting crouch as footsteps approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But a WHITE-GLOVED HAND seizes the Alien by the neck from behind. The Alien gives a whistling hiss as its spine cracks under a terrific force. Rending sounds as the hard-shelled Alien is torn apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts rises out of hiding, scanning the room. DAVID ruined. The Sleeper gone. Stillwell emerges from hiding. Ray. Glasse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's missing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shepherd escorts Vickers toward the exit of the Juggernaut. Turning a corner, they freeze. Ahead of them in their headlamps, a space-suited figure crouches in the middle of the passageway. Doing something with its hands: smoke rises from debris on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's there? The figure turns. The label stencilled on the space suit reads FIFIELD. But the face is of no human shape. A hideous hybrid of the crewman and a hard-shelled Alien, pale and horrific. Its helmet has been shattered by the growth of its elongate skull. Spines have burst through the suit from within, down the crewman's spine. Clawed fingers piercing his gloves. Shepherd and Vickers scream. Shepherd's rifle comes up. But Fifield leaps with inhuman agility, upward into the darkness. Shepherd backs away, headlamp and rifle questing upward. Fifield comes out of the darkness behind him. Claws tearing deep. Shepherd screams and falls, mortally wounded. Vickers runs. Pounding through the dark in blind terror. Fifield comes out of the shadows and hammers her to the deck. She rolls over, gibbering and begging. The Fifield-thing leans close to her faceplate. Its voice is a travesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You.
direction.name: direction
