direction.raw_text: of gunfire. The dying Shepherd empties his clip into Fifield from forty feet away. Acid sluices over Vickers as Fifield collapses on top of her. She dies horribly, caustic liquid eating through space suit, flesh and bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts goes to DAVID's head. She bends over him - and startles when his eyes snap open. His voice is an electronic buzz:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spoke to him. Spoke to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. An electric spasm convulses his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said. I killed him. He'll die. But first. He will launch. The ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Juggernaut?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Send it. To Earth. Another spasm convulses him. His face stiffens. Dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to. Kill him. Watts's eyes widen in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where will he go? DAVID. Where will he go? She slaps his inert cheek. DAVID's eyes flicker and fade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a faint whisper) I set the Magellan free. He dies. Watts looks up at the others. Breathing hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to stop the Engineer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek works frantically as the nightly storm rolls in. Suddenly consoles come alive. The Nav Computer comes back up - but Janek has taken half the instruments apart. Janek scrambles to restore the components he's removed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The war party pursues the Sleeper - Ray in the lead now, Watts right behind him - DAVID's inert head under her arm. Glasse and Stillwell bring up the rear. The Orrery is transformed - no longer a neutral star map, but a flight plan laid in from LV-426 to Earth. The Sleeper stands at the far end of the room, hands gesturing. In Watts's enhanced sight, it's a vision of glory: waves of energy dancing under the Sleeper's touch. Rivers of information flowing. He finishes his work as they enter. Ray draws a bead on him just as he strides out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On me now. Go. Go. He dogtrots forward, gun raised. The others keep pace, deferring instinctively to the soldier's confidence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They emerge into the corridor: empty. A moment of confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pilot's seat. This way. They move toward the Pilot Chamber - and find it empty too. The seat vacant. The door standing open. As they stare inside, baffled, the wall across the corridor - directly behind them - silently unravels. The Sleeper is revealed, a towering gargoyle in his flight suit. He steps forth. Obscure devices clutched in his fists. Too late they perceive him. They spin. Raise their guns. Vanity and foolishness. This is the wrath of an angry god. It seems time slows down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The air roars in their ears. Their guns snap and bark impotently. And then the Sleeper strikes. The missiles he hurls at them are almost invisible. Neither solid projectiles nor directed energy; more like knots tied in the fabric of space itself. The first missile crushes Ray like an invisible fist. The second splashes Glasse against the wall like an insect. Reflexively Stillwell reaches out for Watts. Wraps himself around her protectively. The blow lands an instant later. Stillwell and Watts are hammered against the bulkhead by a staggering impact. Watts is dazed: Stillwell killed. Woozy, she sees the Sleeper step into the Pilot Chamber. The door begins to close. Watts sees that DAVID's head lies just inside the door. She scrambles for it. Too late. The door knits itself into a featureless wall before her reaching hand. Watts is alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Sleeper settles into the pilot's chair: it fuses with him, coming alive. A vast display wraps around the walls - revealing the hangar outside, the stars, the horizon. A mystic view that renders solid matter translucent, painting the fabric of reality in raw information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts pounds in futile rage against the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! The Juggernaut shudders as its systems power up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The floor of the underground hangar begins to rise. The landing lights brighten, shining like a beacon into the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the bridge of the Magellan, Janek stares out. In the distance the Juggernaut rises out of the ground to eclipse the central pyramid. Janek squints, trying to understand what he's seeing A light races toward the Magellan down the canal: a rover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts steers the rover recklessly, hands locked on the controls. Rifle slung over her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek watches the rover come - and the Holloway Alien - boneless and white - unfolds itself from the instruments over his head. Its goblin-shark jaw juts out. Sinks its horrific teeth into Janek's right shoulder. Janek howls in agony. His right arm is paralyzed by the bite. He gropes at the pistol on his right hip with his left hand. The Alien shakes him like a terrier killing a rat. Janek gets the pistol. Flips it in his hand. Fires over his shoulder. Two, three rounds... The bullets punch easily into the Alien - but the soft flesh closes easily over the wounds, sealing its white skin. Its teeth tighten. Watts comes out of nowhere in her space suit. Swings a heavy rifle like a bat with all her strength. A crushing impact wrenches the Alien's jaws loose. It recoils. Watts reverses the rifle. Pulls the trigger. A fusillade of bullets shreds the Alien's head. It collapses, dead. Watts wrenches her helmet off. Rips a first-aid kit from the bulkhead and helps Janek to stanch the bleeding of his horrific wound. She gets the bleeding stopped. Wraps him in bandages. Janek will live - but his right arm is useless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He looks at the body of the dead Alien, which is sinking into the deck plates as acid eats away at the metal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Juggernaut's lifting. There's a living Engineer on board. He's taking the ship to Earth. Janek blinks at her. Uncomprehending.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead. All dead. Janek. We have to stop that ship. Janek stares out the Bridge window at the hulking Juggernaut in its column of light. The nightfall storm front is rolling in, a tidal wave of darkness on the horizon. A swelling rumble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not a gunship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to do something. That ship is genocide if it gets to Earth... Janek stares at her. Makes his decision. Struggles to stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your helmet on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about you? He shakes his head. No. Watts helps him across the Bridge. Props him up in the Captain's seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to be my hands. (stares out at the storm) You're sure about this. Watts nods grimly. Desperate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He reaches out with his left hand. Flips switches. The ship shudders, awakening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red lever. Landing engines main.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The prospecting ship raises its lifts and anchors. Lifts off on landing rockets, retracting its landing struts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek grips the stabilizers with his left hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take the stick. Throttle up, stick forward. Watts sends the Magellan careening toward the Juggernaut - just as the Juggernaut begins to float off the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Magellan barrels toward the Juggernaut, skimming the ground, as the storm wall sweeps closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the Juggernaut's pilot chair, the Sleeper sees them coming. His thoughts quicken. An explosion of light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Juggernaut leaps into the sky. The Magellan roars through the cyclone of dust in its wake. Barely avoids the pyramid. Rakes around in a screaming turn and climbs in pursuit, engines howling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek and Watts strain at the controls together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stick back! Hard!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harder! The Magellan rolls into a howling climb. The storm catches up to them: wind and dust reducing visibility to zero. Darkness. The Magellan's radar finds the Juggernaut. Paints it with targeting data on the Bridge window... But the Juggernaut climbs too fast. Dwindling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't catch that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the floor, DAVID's eyes open. With his jaw he hitches his severed head around. Gets his eyes on the Sleeper. In the pilot chair, the Sleeper convulses. An ALIEN erupts from his chest. Big as a wolf even at its birth. Dark gray, armored, lethal. More hideous than any chestburster we've seen. An ULTRAMORPH. It wails hideously. The Sleeper dies. The Alien slithers free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Juggernaut emerges from the stormclouds into the clear upper air - but loses momentum. Staggers through the upper atmosphere, control lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts, at the Magellan's controls, stares as he Juggernaut falters and falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek. Look. A crackle on the ship's comm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) Dr. Watts. The Engineer is dead. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) You have a few seconds before the Juggernaut's computers take over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAVID. She seizes the precious moment: centers the Juggernaut in the Bridge window. Slams the throttle forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Magellan hurtles out of the storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A colossal impact. The Juggernaut tumbles from the sky like a stone - intact but crippled. The MAGELLAN BREAKS APART - The ship's modules scatter. Some whole, others broken. They fall back into the storm. The Command Module - including the Bridge - falls intact. The engine sections rocket away across the chaotic sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janek is strapped into his seat. Watts goes flying. The Bridge window shatters, spraying glass spears in a lethal barrage across the Bridge. Watts picks herself up. Finds the Module in free fall. Alarms wail. Lights flash. Escape pods pop open. Watts looks at Janek. He is dead in his seat, impaled by a lethal fragment of glass. The storm wall - a chain of hurricanes - rages below them. The command module tumbles back into the winds. Watts dives into a coffin-sized ESCAPE POD. She PUNCHES OUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts's pod - a steel coffin - shoots away on jets through the gale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The command module plunges through the storm, tumbling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in ruin. The engine pods hurtle to the ground and go nuclear, sending walls of fire twisting through the hurricane. The shockwaves tumble Watts's escape pod through the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pod lands, cushioned by a drag chute and retro rockets. Watts pops the pod open, rising painfully to her feet in the storm. She surveys the destruction in disbelief. A deep RUMBLE makes her turn. The JUGGERNAUT ROLLS TOWARD HER - on edge - A crushing wheel of death, big as a mountain. She runs. Like a child in a nightmare. The Juggernaut bears down on her. She turns aside, trying to get out of its course. Even at a dead sprint she barely seems to move, it's so big... The Juggernaut wobbles toward her. Slowing. Exhausted, Watts collapses, gasping. The Juggernaut rolls to the earth, settling like a hoop right around her, Watts in the center. The winds carry the dust clouds away. Watts passes out, dropping her head to the Earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts is awakened by a beeping alarm. She looks at her wrist. Her suit flashes an oxygen warning: 20 MINUTES REMAINING. She looks up. The Juggernaut's doors are wide open in front of her. The ULTRAMORPH ALIEN emerges from the Juggernaut. As large as a man already. It sees her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . With a sob of terror she pulls herself to her feet and runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts flees through the storm, across the burning debris field. A wilderness of lightning, fire, and twisted metal. A thunderstorm with dust instead of rain. She looks back through the darkness. In a strobe-light flicker of lightning, she sees a gray demon approaching through the wreckage. She scrambles through a section of ductwork...under a hull fragment...running and clambering... The Alien hunts her, cat-and-mouse, among the fragments of the Magellan: corridors that go nowhere, shattered compartments. Jetsam. Her eyes sweep frantically through the stormy night: searching for a weapon. A hiding place. An answer. She stumbles into the remains of the Magellan's laboratory. A hypersleep freezer lies on the barren ground. Watts climbs inside. Pulls the lid shut. The Alien passes by, inches away. She watches it through the plexiglass, holding her breath. The Alien roots in the wreckage. Finds the rotting Engineer's head among the shards of its vat. It begins to feed on the head - GROWING as she watches. Her suit's oxygen alarm goes off again. 15 MINUTES REMAINING. The beeping draws the Alien away from its dead meat. Watts is paralyzed. The Alien noses closer. Sniffs at the plexiglass case. With sudden, horrific violence, it lashes out. Sends the freezer flying. Watts tumbles out. Lurches to her feet and runs. The Alien follows. Ravening. She leads it a twisting chase through fragments of burning metal. Watts trips and falls hard. Picking herself up, she sees she's tripped over a HULL SAW - the same diamond-bladed tool
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: used to dismantle the terraforming engine. She seizes the saw - straining to manage its weight. Hides in the hollow of a massive girder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Alien passes by. Scenting the air. She freezes. Her arms trembling with the weight of the saw. Waiting for it to pass. Almost it leaves. But a tiny rattle of metal from the quivering saw brings it back. Out of options, Watts powers up the saw. The blade whines up to speed. They lunge at one another in the same moment. The diamond blade shears off one of the Alien's claws. The monster screams and recoils. Its lashing tail sends Watts sprawling. She loses the saw. The Alien comes after her, slinking low to the ground, injured arm tucked to its chest. All vengeful fury. Watts scrambles for the saw. The Alien leaps for her. She rolls aside - and like a scorpion the Alien impales her thigh with its spear-tipped tail. Nails her to the ground. Watts screams in agony. Reaches for the saw, still buzzing on the ground. Its grip tantalizing inches from her fingertips. The Alien stoops over her, slavering face inches from her faceplate. Its hideous jaws open. With all her strength, Watts pulls against the spike in her leg. Drags the point of the spear through the dirt. Excruciating pain. She snarls through her teeth. The Alien strikes - just as Watts GRABS the saw. She meets the Alien's head with the buzzing blade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A gout of green acid onto Watts's helmet. The Alien falls aside, thrashing its death-throes, the saw still growling. Watts sees ACID COMING THROUGH HER HELMET - fast. With frantic haste she unlatches her helmet. Wrenches it off as it crumples and melts. She stands bare-headed in the toxic air. Desperate, she looks around with tearing eyes. In the distance she sees an intact module of the Magellan. She runs for it. Slaps the door switch. Incredibly, it opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts steps inside. The airlock closes behind her. She finds herself staring at a grand piano. She's in Vickers's suite. Its amenities intact, through the floor's a few degrees off level. She takes a breath. Good air. She walks around. Turning things on. Lights. Music. Surreal comforts. She drinks water from the tap. She opens the door to Vickers's secret room. Military space suits. Rifles. Ammunition. A crackle from the room's intercom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) Dr. Watts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: s head lies battered in a dark corner of the wrecked Juggernaut. Eyes staring into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you're there. I can hear the beacon of your suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts strips off her space suit wearily. Sits on the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) I'd like to propose an arrangement. I can be repaired. I can talk you through it. Watts shakes her head wearily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) I think you'll find I can be of use to you. Watts walks to the intercom and switches it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The storm has passed. The fragments of the Magellan no longer burn. The gray world of LV-426 restored. The wreck of the Juggernaut looms in the misty distance. Watts walks through the wreckage in a military space suit. Rifle on her shoulder. Pistol on her hip. She pulls a cargo dolly loaded with salvage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts arrives at the Vickers module. The ultramorph Alien's head has been fixed like a grisly trophy above the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watts strips off her space suit. She helps herself to a glass of vodka from the bar. A chessboard sits atop the grand piano: a game in progress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) I've decided. Rook takes Bishop. Watts nods. Makes the move on the board. Says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) Have you decided? On our arrangement?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to fix you, DAVID. I don't need you. I'll hold out. A ship will come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) I'm certain. But who will send it? Men? Or Engineers? Watts falls silent. She stares unhappily at the chessboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FILTERED) Dr. Watts. It's your move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The massive central pyramid rises in the midst of the Engineer complex. With a BOOM, a bright beam of light shines forth from its peak, punching straight up through the clouds like a laser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - AROUND LV-426 Other beams of light erupt from other pyramids. Scorching the sky with their brightness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The barren moon hangs in space, its father planet an angry red god in the background. Two dozen beams of light rise from the moon, visible even from space. A beacon. A signal. A beginning.
direction.name: direction
